locations.name: Dorrin
locations.description: Village of Rockwinders on Mount Arbora's western slopes. Guides and traders.
locations.trouble: Supply routes becoming unreliable as mountain weather worsens
locations.quirk: Small settlement on Mount Arbora's western slopes

sites.name: The Golden Stag
sites.description: A cozy establishment with warm beds and hot meals

rumors.text: The old telescope operator at AHA keeps hearing voices on a First Age radio. He says they're 'war dispatches.'
A new face in Toggle — quiet, keeps to himself, asks a lot of questions about the Mariners' Guild.
We've tried everything for the supply routes becoming unreliable as mountain weather worsens. Nothing works. Maybe outsiders could help.
The old The Golden Stag has a hidden cellar. Sealed up years ago. Nobody remembers why.
Refugees from the east claim The Shadowed Altar is the source of the blight spreading across the land.
The Crowsworn is offering good coin for information about Archaeologists, Historians & Archivists's movements.

notices.title: LOST SPIRIT COMPANION
notices.description: Small fire spirit — looks like a glowing fox. Answers to Kiri. Last seen near the market. Please do not attempt to capture.

notices.title: HERBALIST NEEDED
notices.description: Village healer overwhelmed. Anyone with knowledge of medicinal plants or spirit remedies please come forward.

sensoryImpressions: Thin mountain air carries the scent of alpine flowers
Clouds drift below the village in the morning
Wind whistles through rocky outcroppings

locations.name: Coastal Divers' Lodge (North)
locations.description: NW coast outpost. Water Clock and Pixie Boat nearby.
locations.trouble: Lionfish King targeting Holly Clintock; keeping the lighthouse operational with limited staff
locations.quirk: Mariners' Guild northern lodge at Pelican's Nest Lighthouse. Holly Clintock's workshop. Marcel the blind lighthouse keeper navigates by sonar.

sites.name: The Black Lion
sites.description: A well-maintained inn popular with travelers
sites.quirk: A faded portrait watches visitors

sites.name: Farmer's Bazaar
sites.description: A covered marketplace with permanent stalls
sites.quirk: A faded portrait watches visitors

rumors.text: The old telescope operator at AHA keeps hearing voices on a First Age radio. He says they're 'war dispatches.'
Magical graffiti keeps appearing on Canden & Moon's school walls. The paint moves and whispers.
I heard Canden & Moon's School and Dawn Blossom Guild had a... disagreement. Bodies were involved.
The a beast no one's seen before attacks are getting bolder. Closer to town each time.
Vymm inherited a map but can't read it. Might be worth something to the right person.

rumors.text: Courier Brigade packages keep vanishing from wagons in Yatamon. The detective duo Gomber and Beeks are on the case.
Magical graffiti keeps appearing on Canden & Moon's school walls. The paint moves and whispers.
Morris was asking around about Courier Brigade. Seemed scared. Real scared.
They pulled a body from the river - covered in wounds no beast could make. He had a sketch of Sunken Town & Underwater Depot in his pocket.
Mr. Noka Noka inherited a map but can't read it. Might be worth something to the right person.
We've tried everything for the maintaining crossroads security as eastern routes become more dangerous; delicate non-aggression with fish head coven. Nothing works. Maybe outsiders could help.

notices.title: SPIRIT SHRINE DAMAGED
notices.description: The wayshrine on the eastern road has been vandalized. Stonemason or anyone with spirit-mending skills please respond.

notices.title: FISH FOLK SIGHTING
notices.description: Armed fish folk spotted near the coast at dawn. Travelers should move in groups and stay on marked paths.

sensoryImpressions: Courier birds call from the battlements at all hours
The stamp of running boots on packed earth as cadets train
Wind-battered pennants snap from every tower

locations.name: Witching Tower (Fish Head Coven)
locations.description: Fish Head Coven compound. Council of Three and Thirty. Four Gatehouses.
locations.trouble: Elder spirit Sorolu suffering an unknown malady weakening domain magic; Fish Head scouts vs Council of Kroo territorial dispute
locations.quirk: Three brick towers connected by bridges. Magical hedgerow alerts the Council when crossed. Chot-to spy statues record conversations. The Closed Fists vaults hold dangerous ingredients and items.

sites.name: The Golden Lion
sites.description: A rustic lodge with a roaring fireplace
sites.quirk: A faded portrait watches visitors

sites.name: Old Square
sites.description: A bustling open-air market
sites.quirk: The staff speaks in hushed tones

rumors.text: A new face in Toggle — quiet, keeps to himself, asks a lot of questions about the Mariners' Guild.
The Lionfish King's wizard is offering a fortune to anyone who can translate ancient nakudama texts.
Fish Head Coven is offering good coin for information about Courier Brigade's movements.
The elder spirit sorolu suffering an unknown malady weakening domain magic; fish head scouts vs council of kroo territorial dispute is just the surface. There's something deeper going on here.
A child went missing near The Forgotten Keep. The search party found only her doll - and strange tracks leading inside.
The old Witches' Bridge has a hidden cellar. Sealed up years ago. Nobody remembers why.

notices.title: RARE INGREDIENTS SOUGHT
notices.description: The Coven purchases unusual botanical specimens, spirit residues, and Corruption samples (properly sealed). Bring to the nearest hedgerow witch.

notices.title: HELP WANTED
notices.description: An ancient spirit in the Gale Fields is sick. The land itself seems to be weaken... Ask around for details.

notices.title: HERBALIST NEEDED
notices.description: Village healer overwhelmed. Anyone with knowledge of medicinal plants or spirit remedies please come forward.

sensoryImpressions: The hedgerow hums with a faint magical vibration
Cauldron smoke drifts between the three towers in lazy spirals
Animated chot-to statues murmur to each other when they think no one listens

locations.name: Ekmu Village
locations.description: Settlement at the eastern forest edge.
locations.trouble: Sunken village haunted by demon Slaathti; nakudama temple submerged and corrupted
locations.quirk: Sunken village graveyard with a corrupted nakudama temple. Demon Slaathti (giant eel) dwells in the underwater ruins.

rumors.text: Villagers in the Graysteps report strange sounds from elder Phent's cellar. He insists it's just his cat.
A Toraf & Boulder student expedition sent to Polewater hasn't reported back.
The old-timers say when crows circle the tower appears, someone goes missing. We saw crows circle the tower last night.
The bubbling cauldron at The Twisted Hovel isn't abandoned. Someone - or something - has been stockpiling supplies there.
Join Fish Head Coven? You'd have to do something to prove yourself first. Something ugly.
Don't trust Dr. Zalia Frond. I've seen the letters they burn. Someone's pulling their strings.

notices.title: FESTIVAL PREPARATIONS
notices.description: Volunteers needed for the upcoming spirit festival. Lantern-makers, musicians, and cooks especially welcome.

notices.title: CREATURE BOUNTY
notices.description: Corrupted beast spotted near the fields. Livestock killed. Armed volunteers needed to track and eliminate the threat.

notices.title: MISSING TRAVELERS
notices.description: Two merchants have not arrived from the eastern settlements. Last seen on the Brackwater road. Any information welcome.

sensoryImpressions: Bubbles rise from submerged structures visible through murky water
A deep vibration from below — Slaathti moving in the depths
Corrupted water gives off a faint phosphorescent glow at night

locations.name: Opal Falls
locations.description: Cascading waterfalls from the highland plateau.
locations.trouble: Water-powered elevator system needs constant maintenance; river spirit Din's moods affecting toll collection
locations.quirk: Built around the tallest waterfall on Obojima. Vertical industry powered by falling water. Wayla oversees river traffic and the original postal box honoring spirit Din.

The wolf pack attacks are getting bolder. Closer to town each time.
Someone's been leaving Courier Brigade's mark around town. They're recruiting - or warning.

locations.description: First Age airfield ruins. Spirit Plitsu guards.
locations.trouble: 12 harpies in the control tower; missing Young Stewards; Plitsu secretly sabotaging Phin; dormant slime colony under the runway
locations.quirk: First Age airstrip with derelict aircraft. Phin lives in a hangar restoring 'the Menace.' Harpies dress as pilots. Pickle brine keeps them at bay.

sites.description: A cozy establishment with warm beds and hot meals

The Mariners' Guild is desperate to recover a stolen navigation device from the Lionfish King's warship.
They say the underground lake at Crak Caves holds treasure from the old kingdom. Cursed, probably.
Fish Head Coven lost something valuable. They're not advertising, but they're searching hard.
They pulled a body from the river - covered in wounds no beast could make. He had a sketch of The Forgotten Spire in his pocket.
Three travelers vanished on the road near Crumpled Hut. The only survivor babbled about caged creatures before dying.

sensoryImpressions: The sharp tang of pickle brine and aviation grease
Harpies in flight jackets and goggles cackling from the control tower
Wind whistling through the skeletal frames of rusting aircraft

locations.description: Sandy coastal village. Tower of Glass holds the Pearl of Rongol.
locations.trouble: Coastal erosion eating away at the hardened sand buildings; the Pearl of Rongol in the Tower of Glass attracting unwanted attention
locations.quirk: Every structure is built from magically hardened sand; sand sculptors shape buildings by hand like potters at a wheel

Don't take the road past Toraf & Boulder's School. Something's hunting travelers. The guards found pieces.

Someone needs to do something about the coastal erosion eating away at the hardened sand buildings; the pearl of rongol in the tower of glass attracting unwanted attention. The guard won't. The mayor can't.
Before Ermina Flopfoot came here, they went by a different name. The kind of name people remember.
Someone's been digging in the rocky hills at night. Looking for something buried.

notices.title: SWORD TOURNAMENT
notices.description: Open tournament at month's end. All sword styles welcome. Entry fee: 2 Gold Flowers. Winner takes the pot and a master-forged blade.

notices.title: WELL WATER ADVISORY
notices.description: The eastern well tastes strange. Avoid until tested. Use the market fountain instead.

notices.title: ROAD CLEARING
notices.description: Fallen trees blocking the north road after last storm. Bring axes. Lunch provided by the inn.

sensoryImpressions: Granular walls glitter with embedded shell fragments in the sunlight
The constant susurrus of waves reshaping the beach
Salt-crusted air carries the sound of sculptors chanting shaping songs

locations.description: Observatory and research campus. The Asloh triumvirate.
locations.trouble: Corrupted viperfish folk in flooded basement; researchers falling ill from Corruption exposure; spread too thin across dig sites
locations.quirk: 19-level observatory on a promontory. Telescope, labs, archive, curio museum. Lonzo's radio picks up mysterious war dispatches. Corrupted fish folk secretly beneath.

A giant octopus near the sunken town seems to be in distress, guarding something against its will.

The scratch of chronicler spirits' quills on scroll strips

locations.description: Largest city on Obojima. Spirit trolleys, detective agencies, undercity.
locations.trouble: Goro Goros magical graffiti defacing buildings; subway tunnels beneath the city growing more dangerous; Mortimus Fids gatekeeping the library
locations.quirk: Largest city on Obojima (~10k). Neon signs from the First Age still flicker along Fire Snake Alley. A trolley runs through the center. The Courier Brigade HQ is a former First Age bank.

The echoing depths at Crak Caves isn't abandoned. Someone - or something - has been stockpiling supplies there.

The Archaeologists, Historians & Archivists war is coming to a head. Pick a side or get caught in the middle.

sensoryImpressions: Salt spray and the creak of dock timbers
Bioluminescent specimens glow in the aquarium windows
Diving suits hang to dry like strange scarecrows along the pier

locations.name: Sunken Town & Underwater Depot
locations.description: First Age ruins submerged on white sand 200 feet below the surface, connected to the Wandering Line depot system. A ghost town of perfectly preserved buildings, asphalt roads, and a train station — all claimed by fish folk pirates under Bloodfin the Foul. A gentle giant octopus named Lucinda is held hostage, her eggs used as leverage.

rooms.name: Main Road
rooms.description: Clear First Age asphalt stretching between submerged buildings. Little wear despite the ages — some seaweed growth. The water is crystal-clear in the magical Shallows, visibility 200 feet. Colorful reef fish swim between the rooftops like birds.

rooms.name: Train Depot
rooms.description: A well-built wooden structure with arrival and departure times still posted on a board. Witch's Eye Coral clusters glow faintly on the platform. Sligo, a mischievous sea sprite, lurks here — she'll trade information about the fish folk pirates for a pearl from Bloodfin's giant clam.

secrets.description: A hidden compartment in the wall

rooms.name: Fish Folk Hideout
rooms.description: A large First Age warehouse occupied by 8 fish folk pirates guarding a stolen kite-plane. Bloodfin the Foul has a 25% chance of being present. The pirates have decorated the interior with salvaged trinkets and territorial markers.

features.name: Unnatural Torches
features.description: Torches burn with an unnatural flame

discoveries.description: Signs of a fierce battle mark this area

rooms.name: Moxy's Music Grotto
rooms.description: A First Age music store filled with waterlogged instruments. Morris, a cowardly giant sea horse spirit, hides here. He stole the kite-plane for Bloodfin but is terrified of Slurpgill the sea hag. He whinnies nervously at any approach.

hazards.name: Sinkhole Pool
hazards.description: What appears to be a shallow tide pool conceals a deep sinkhole
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping into the deceptively deep pool
hazards.passiveHint: The water is unusually dark; you can't see the bottom
hazards.activeHint: A current pulls gently toward the center of the pool
disarmMethods: Walk around the edge of the pool
Probe with a pole before stepping
Drop a weighted line to check depth
Light a torch and look for the water's movement
hazards.consequence: Connects to underwater passages; may find air pockets

historicalClues: Signs of the refugees are visible: prayer beads

rooms.name: Jerry's Garage
rooms.description: A First Age garage with rusted tools, an old kei truck, and ancient mopeds. Four giant crabs have nested in the toolshed. The vehicles are beyond repair but contain salvageable First Age components.
historicalClues: Signs of the fallen kingdom are visible: broken banners

rooms.name: Bloodfin's Lair
rooms.description: An old Goodie Mart decorated in gothic deep-sea style — Bloodfin the Foul's lair. A giant clam holds a 500 Gold Flower pearl (DC 16 STR to pry open). Lucinda the gentle Awakened Giant Octopus is held nearby, her eggs used as leverage to force her into guard duty.

rooms.name: Storage Lockers
rooms.description: Train station storage lockers (DC 20 to pick). One contains an indestructible suitcase (DC 25 magic lock) holding a Neko Ronin figurine in original packaging — the interior kept magically dry. Worth a fortune to collectors.

secrets.description: A narrow crawlway hidden by rubble

discoveries.description: Skeletal remains wearing gear from decades ago

hazards.name: Covered Pit
hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section
hazards.passiveHint: The floor sounds hollow when walked on
hazards.activeHint: Seams in the dust outline a rectangular section of floor
disarmMethods: Walk along the walls where the floor is solid
Probe ahead with a 10-foot pole
Throw heavy objects to trigger it safely
hazards.consequence: The pit remains open, blocking direct passage

trap.name: Razor Barnacles
trap.description: Sharp-edged barnacles coat every surface in a narrow squeeze
trap.trigger: Squeezing through the narrow passage with exposed skin
trap.passiveHint: The passage narrows; white crusting covers the walls
trap.activeHint: Old blood stains the rock; shells glint with knife-sharp edges
disarmMethods: Wrap hands and exposed skin before climbing through
Scrape a path clear with a shield or metal tool
Apply oil or grease for protection
Find an alternate route through a wider passage
trap.consequence: Bleeding attracts predatory sea creatures

ecology.history: The smugglers abandoned this place long ago. Sahuagin raiders moved in.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 3 turns or on loud noise

exitPoints.description: A natural chimney to the cliffs above

locations.name: The Coral Castle
locations.description: The underwater fortress of the Lionfish King — a hill-sized mound of coral covered in sea vegetation, flanked by poisonous anemones large enough to devour trespassers. The hollow upper half houses his court of frogfish advisors, barracuda warriors, and noble courtiers. Elite crab sentinels patrol the gates. At the base, a sea cave holds the Crimson Octopus 'Boombox,' whose ink is worth a fortune.

rooms.name: The Coral Gate
rooms.description: A towering arch of living coral flanked by two massive poisonous anemones — their translucent tendrils sway lazily, each thick enough to enfold a person. Armored crab sentinels stand motionless on either side, clicking their claws in warning. The water here is warm and murky with silt.

rooms.name: Anemone Garden
rooms.description: A passage through a forest of smaller anemones and sea fans. Colorful reef fish dart between the fronds. Barracuda warriors patrol in pairs, sleek and silver, watching visitors with predatory eyes. The walls are living coral — cutting yourself is easy, bleeding is dangerous.

secrets.description: A hidden compartment in the wall

rooms.name: Crab Sentinel Barracks
rooms.description: A series of carved-out coral chambers where the elite crab sentinels rest. Their shells are decorated with barnacle-encrusted insignia. Weapons — tridents, nets, hooks — hang from coral pegs. The crabs are fanatically loyal to the King.

hazards.name: Alarm Bells
hazards.description: Tripwires connected to loud brass bells throughout the fortress
hazards.save: DC 10 DEX to catch the bell before it rings
hazards.trigger: Walking through the tripwire
hazards.passiveHint: Faint sounds of bells deeper in the fortress
hazards.activeHint: A thin cord stretches across the doorway at ankle height
disarmMethods: Step over the tripwire carefully
Crawl under the wire
Muffle the bell with cloth before triggering
hazards.consequence: All creatures in the fortress go to alert status; patrols double

historicalClues: Signs of the dwarven clan are visible: stone masonry

rooms.name: Hall of Noble Courtiers
rooms.description: A grand gallery where the Lionfish King holds court. Butterfly fish nobles drift in colorful clouds. Pufferfish diplomats inflate nervously. Moray eels lurk in coral crevices, watching. Sleethar the royal consigliere — an ancient ocean mage in moray eel form — coils near the throne.

rooms.name: The Throne of Spines
rooms.description: An enormous chamber at the coral mound's hollow center. The Lionfish King's throne is a fan of poisonous spines, each as long as a spear. The King himself is magnificent and terrifying — venomous fins spread like a war banner, his mood shifting from magnanimous to murderous in a heartbeat.
historicalClues: Signs of the dwarven clan are visible: rune carvings

rooms.name: The Royal Library
rooms.description: A waterlogged chamber containing stolen nakudama tomes — the Royal Lineages tracking the old monarchy's bloodline. The books are preserved in sealed First Age containers. The King studies them obsessively, seeking a nakudama princess of royal blood to marry and legitimize his rule.

rooms.name: War Room
rooms.description: Maps of the Shallows etched into the coral walls — territorial boundaries, patrol routes, the encroaching threat of Venomous Rex from the east. A scale model of the Doomspine war barge sits on a stone table. Plans for the stolen submarine prow — the Pointue — are spread beside it.

rooms.name: Doomspine Dock
rooms.description: A vast underwater cavern where the Doomspine war barge is moored — a grotesque vessel cobbled from salvaged shipwrecks. Its prow is the stolen front half of Captain Clintock's submarine, the Pointue, containing the Aquatic Stabilizer. Fish folk pirates load and unload plunder.

Bloodstained Letter

My dearest Aldric, by the time you read this, I will be deep within the fortress. dwarven clan hired us to retrieve the the artifact. If we succeed, we'll be rich. If not... don't let them forget us.

locations.name: Crak Caves
locations.description: A winding cave system in the western hills of the Gift of Shuritashi. The caves are home to colonies of cuddle bugs and deeper chambers hold deposits of spirit-touched minerals. Rangers from the Greenward Path use the upper caves as supply caches, but something has been raiding their stores.

rooms.name: Hill Mouth
rooms.description: A wide cave entrance hidden behind a curtain of hanging vines. Ranger trail markers are scratched into the stone — the Greenward Path uses this as a waypoint. Cool air flows outward. Cuddle bug tracks dot the sandy floor.

hazards.name: Unstable Ceiling
hazards.description: A section of loose rock precariously balanced above
hazards.save: DC 13 DEX to dive clear
hazards.trigger: Loud noises or vibrations from movement
hazards.passiveHint: Small pebbles occasionally fall from above
hazards.activeHint: A network of cracks spreads across the ceiling; support timbers are rotted
disarmMethods: Move through quietly, one at a time
Crawl along the wall where the ceiling is more stable
Trigger the collapse from a safe distance with thrown rocks
hazards.consequence: Loud crash alerts all creatures within 200 feet; may block passage

rooms.name: Supply Cache
rooms.description: A dry upper chamber where Rangers store emergency supplies — dried food, rope, torches, healing herbs. Something has been raiding the crates: claw marks, scattered rations, and a half-eaten leather satchel. The raids started a month ago.

discoveries.description: Scratch marks suggest something was moved regularly

rooms.name: Cuddle Bug Colony
rooms.description: A warm chamber full of burrowing cuddle bugs — small creatures that drain body heat. They cluster in piles, their faint bioluminescence casting the room in blue-green light. They're drawn to warmth and will swarm anyone who stays too long.

secrets.description: A hidden lever opens a secret door

rooms.name: Crystal Grotto
rooms.description: A breathtaking cavern where spirit-touched minerals line the walls — translucent crystals that hum faintly when touched. The minerals are valuable to the Fish Head Coven and Lom & Salt's forges. Mining here would be profitable but dangerous — the crystals are structurally important.

rooms.name: The Deep Pool
rooms.description: A subterranean lake of perfectly still, black water. Something large ripples the surface occasionally. Blind cave fish bump against boots. The water is ice cold and impossibly deep — a dropped torch disappears without hitting bottom.
historicalClues: Signs of the primitive tribe are visible: fire pits

Final Entry of The Reckless Few's Journal

trap.description: A floor tile triggers poison darts from concealed wall slots
trap.trigger: Stepping on the raised floor tile
trap.passiveHint: Tiny holes line the walls at chest height
trap.activeHint: One floor tile is slightly raised and a different color
disarmMethods: Step over the obvious pressure plate
Crawl beneath the dart trajectory
Jam cloth into the dart holes
trap.consequence: The clicking alerts creatures in adjacent rooms

trap.name: Slippery Slope
trap.description: A steep, wet limestone slope drops into darkness
trap.trigger: Walking onto the wet slope without caution
trap.passiveHint: The sound of dripping water and a cold updraft
trap.activeHint: The floor gleams wetly and angles sharply downward
disarmMethods: Sit down and scoot along carefully
Slide down intentionally to see the bottom
Anchor a rope at the top and descend carefully
trap.consequence: Lands in a lower level or underground pool

ecology.history: The giant burrowers abandoned this place long ago. Monster nest moved in.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 3 turns or on loud noise

exitPoints.description: A tight squeeze through natural rock formations
A water-carved tunnel following an underground stream

locations.name: Temple of Shoom
locations.description: An ancient nakudama ziggurat mostly submerged in Lake Ellior. Once the largest hatching site on the island, where families brought eggs to be tended by sacred midwives. Sealed after the warlock Voraro the Parasite enthralled the midwives and offered eggs as tribute to his greedy spirit patron. Lights are visible deep beneath the lake at night — something stirs within.

rooms.name: Shore Ruins
rooms.description: Crumbled nakudama stonework lines the southern shore of Lake Ellior. Foundation stones carved with egg-shaped glyphs — the symbol of the hatching site. A pilgrim's trail leads to a stone dock, half-submerged, where boats once brought families and their precious eggs.

rooms.name: The Drowning Steps
rooms.description: Stone steps descend into Lake Ellior, leading to the ziggurat's upper terrace. The water is dark and cold. At depth, faint lights pulse — rhythmic, like a heartbeat. Corrupted fish circle at the boundary where fresh water meets something else.

rooms.name: Hatching Terrace
rooms.description: The ziggurat's broad upper level, designed for communal egg-tending. Stone nests line the walls — each sized for a clutch of nakudama eggs. The midwives' tools remain: warming stones, incubation lamps, hatching records carved in stone. Everything is covered in lake silt.
historicalClues: Signs of the necromancer are visible: shattered vials

rooms.name: Midwives' Quarters
rooms.description: Living chambers for the sacred midwives. Personal effects remain — robes, prayer beads, half-finished letters. The enthrallment happened suddenly. Some midwives tried to resist — scratch marks on the inside of sealed doors.

hazards.name: Covered Pit
hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section
hazards.passiveHint: The floor sounds hollow when walked on
hazards.activeHint: Seams in the dust outline a rectangular section of floor
disarmMethods: Walk along the walls where the floor is solid
Probe ahead with a 10-foot pole
Throw heavy objects to trigger it safely
hazards.consequence: The pit remains open, blocking direct passage

rooms.name: The Offering Chamber
rooms.description: A vast chamber at the ziggurat's heart. An altar stained dark with old rituals. This is where Voraro offered nakudama eggs to his spirit patron. The walls are carved with scenes of the hatching ceremony — defaced with Voraro's own twisted glyphs.
historicalClues: Signs of the sun worshippers are visible: gold decorations

rooms.name: Voraro's Sanctum
rooms.description: The warlock's private chamber, sealed behind wards that still pulse with power. Inside: a throne of fused eggshells, occult instruments, and a mirror that shows not your reflection but something watching from the other side. The spirit patron may still be bound here.

secrets.description: A secret door behind a tapestry

rooms.name: The Deep Seal
rooms.description: The lowest level of the ziggurat, far below the lake's surface. A massive stone door carved with nakudama sealing magic. The lights visible from the surface originate here — something pushes against the seal from within. Cracks have appeared. The corrupted fish cluster at this depth.
historicalClues: Signs of the necromancer are visible: alchemical stains

trap.name: Guardian Idol
trap.description: A statue's eyes glow and it pronounces judgment on trespassers
trap.trigger: Passing in front of the idol without showing respect
trap.passiveHint: The statue's eyes are inset with crystals that catch the light
trap.activeHint: Other statues along the hall have been defaced or toppled
disarmMethods: Bow respectfully as you pass
Crawl past below the statue's line of sight
Cover the crystal eyes with cloth
Approach while wearing holy symbols of the temple's faith
trap.consequence: Loudly announces presence to all in the temple

locations.name: Glittering Depot
locations.description: A long-forgotten mine near Toggle at the eastern slope of Mount Arbora. A maze of tunnels connects gem-encrusted caverns, monster lairs, and surface exits. One of three Wandering Line depot stops — an ancient First Age train system. Spirit Coal, a prized alchemical ingredient, can be found in the hopper cars.

rooms.name: Mine Entrance
rooms.description: A timber-framed opening in the hillside near Toggle. Old rail tracks disappear into darkness. The miners left generations ago but the supports are First Age alloy — still holding strong. A draft carries the faint smell of minerals and something electric.

rooms.name: Cart Junction
rooms.description: Three tunnels converge at a switching point. Rusted ore carts sit on the tracks. One tunnel leads deeper into gem caverns, one angles upward to a surface exit, and the third descends toward rumbling sounds and warmth. Yokario music faintly echoes from one passage.

discoveries.description: Fresh footprints in the dust suggest recent passage

rooms.name: Gem Cavern
rooms.description: A dazzling natural chamber where veins of crystallized minerals catch any light and scatter it into rainbows. The gems are spirit-touched — faintly warm to the touch. Careful extraction could yield valuable stones, but crude mining risks a collapse.

rooms.name: Wandering Line Platform
rooms.description: A First Age train platform, impossibly preserved. Tiled floors, metal benches, destination signs listing stops: 'Cloud Station — Glittering Depot — Prison Terminal — Island of Hmug.' A hopper car sits on the track, half-full of Spirit Coal — dark crystals that shimmer with trapped energy.

features.name: Bone Pile
features.description: Piles of bones in the corners

rooms.name: Deep Workings
rooms.description: The lowest mining tunnels, where the original miners stopped digging. Tool marks end abruptly — they hit something they couldn't cut. First Age metal walls, smooth and featureless, block the passage. The Wandering Line track runs through a sealed door in this wall.

secrets.description: A hidden lever opens a secret door

hazards.description: A pocket of explosive mining gas ignites from any open flame
hazards.save: DC 14 DEX for half
hazards.trigger: Bringing an open flame into the area
hazards.passiveHint: A faint, sweet smell; the air feels thick
hazards.activeHint: Canaries or other small animals lie dead; torches flicker oddly
disarmMethods: Extinguish all flames before entering
Use a hooded lantern with the vent closed
Ventilate the area by fanning air through
Cast Light instead of using fire
hazards.consequence: Explosion may cause ceiling collapse; may trap the party

locations.name: Prison of Oghmai
locations.description: Deep within Mount Arbora lies the prison of Oghmai — the Demon Emperor of the nakudama, imprisoned since the Second Age. The Deep Current faction secretly steers AHA excavations toward passages leading here. Layers of nakudama sealing magic guard the descent, each weaker than the last. Something has been eroding them from within.

rooms.name: Arbora Tunnel Entrance
rooms.description: A crack in the mountain's interior, hidden behind a waterfall. Nakudama warning glyphs are carved into every surface — do not enter, do not listen, do not speak his name. The air is warm and smells of sulfur. The Deep Current has been quietly widening this passage.

rooms.name: First Seal Chamber
rooms.description: A vast circular room. The floor is a single carved seal — concentric rings of nakudama binding magic, cracked but holding. Spirit energy hums in the walls. Each ring represents a generation of nakudama wardens who renewed the seals. The outermost ring is dark — broken.

rooms.name: Hall of Wardens
rooms.description: Statues of nakudama wardens line a descending corridor — each holding a symbolic key. Their stone faces show determination hardening into despair as you go deeper. The last few statues are unfinished — the warden line ended. No one has renewed the seals in centuries.

rooms.name: The Whispering Gallery
rooms.description: A natural cavern where sound behaves wrong. Whispers from below are amplified into almost-intelligible speech. Oghmai's voice, filtered through layers of sealing magic, offers bargains, threats, and truths designed to corrode resolve. Staying too long risks madness.

features.name: Bone Pile
features.description: Piles of bones in the corners

rooms.name: Wandering Line Terminal
rooms.description: A forgotten First Age train platform — 'Prison Terminal' reads the sign. The track continues deeper but is blocked by collapsed stone. Spirit Coal dust coats everything. Someone has been here recently — fresh boot prints in the ancient dust. Deep Current operatives.

features.name: Bone Pile
features.description: Piles of bones in the corners

discoveries.description: A locked strongbox contains rolled documents
discoveries.content:
Crude Map

Shows a rough sketch of the dungeon, with 'DANGER' scrawled near deepest level and an 'X' marking what appears to be the relic.

rooms.name: Second Seal Chamber
rooms.description: Another sealing room, deeper. This seal is stronger but visibly strained — hairline cracks radiate from the center. The air is hot. Shadows move wrong. Something immense presses against the other side. The demon emperor is awake and aware.

features.name: Rubble
features.description: Rubble blocks part of the room

rooms.name: The Threshold
rooms.description: The final chamber before the prison itself. No one living has seen what lies beyond the last door — a slab of nakudama-forged metal ten feet thick, covered in every protective glyph their civilization ever devised. It vibrates. It's warm to the touch. From behind it comes a sound like breathing.

locations.name: Salty Sue
locations.description: A wrecked merchant vessel beached on the Brackwater shore, its hull cracked open like an egg. The Salty Sue ran aground during the tsunami and now serves as a makeshift shelter for scavengers and a navigation hazard for coastal traffic. Gulls roost in the rigging. Locals say the cargo hold still contains sealed crates that no one has been able to open — the locks are First Age mechanism work, and whatever's inside shifts when you press your ear to the wood.

rooms.name: The Beached Hull
rooms.description: The Salty Sue lies cracked open on the sand, listing badly to port. Gulls roost in the remaining rigging. A makeshift camp of scavengers clusters around the gap in the hull. Two crews are arguing over salvage rights.

rooms.name: Upper Cargo Hold
rooms.description: Crates and barrels tumbled everywhere when the ship hit. Most have been picked clean. But at the back, bolted to the hull with First Age mechanism locks, sit three sealed crates that hum faintly. Press your ear to the wood — something shifts inside.

locations.name: Amak Shurak
locations.description: A homebrew village on the Gale Fields plains.
locations.trouble: Demon consuming villagers in exchange for heart stones that power the forges and Spirit Blades; 'workers needed' signs in woods are a trap
locations.quirk: Homebrew town that crafts Spirit Blades using heart stones from a demon. The demon is the town elder's grandson, spirit-bonded with a demon.

sites.name: The Golden Lion
sites.description: A rustic lodge with a roaring fireplace

sites.name: Reliable Supply
sites.description: A well-organized store with helpful staff

sites.name: Central Square
sites.description: A covered marketplace with permanent stalls

rumors.text: Some Young Stewards snuck onto the Broken Bird Airfield on a dare and haven't come back.
Air pirates on Mount Arbora's western slope seem to know Master Lom. They keep calling her 'old friend.'
Ermina Flopfoot has been meeting someone outside town at night. Won't say who. Won't say why.
Mariners' Guild is looking for someone with your skills. The pay is good. The work... less so.

Three families left town this week. All of them mentioned the demon consuming villagers in exchange for heart stones that power the forges and spirit blades; 'workers needed' signs in woods are a trap.
Lock your doors when the fog rolls in. That's when the night hunters comes out.

notices.title: FISH FOLK SIGHTING
notices.description: Armed fish folk spotted near the coast at dawn. Travelers should move in groups and stay on marked paths.

notices.title: WELL WATER ADVISORY
notices.description: The eastern well tastes strange. Avoid until tested. Use the market fountain instead.

notices.title: CREATURE BOUNTY
notices.description: Corrupted beast spotted near the fields. Livestock killed. Armed volunteers needed to track and eliminate the threat.

sensoryImpressions: An eerie crimson glow emanates from the forge at night
Heart stones pulse with faint warmth in display cases
The air tastes metallic, and workers avoid eye contact with strangers

locations.name: Island of Hmug
locations.description: A remote island far offshore of the Land of Hot Water, accessible via the Wandering Line — a magical First Age train system with depots in the clouds, inside Mount Arbora's Prison of Oghmai, and in the Glittering Depot mine near Toggle. The island's true nature and purpose are largely unknown, but the Wandering Line's hopper contains Spirit Coal — a prized material sought by ingredient hunters and smiths alike.
encounters: A Council of Kroo floppy disk mentions coordinates that may correspond to the Island of Hmug
A Wandering Line depot map shows Hmug as the final stop — but the track there is marked with warning glyphs
Spirit Coal from the Wandering Line's hopper is worth a fortune to the right buyer

locations.name: Master Chen's Water Clock
locations.description: A giant tower built in the Shallows outside Sky Kite Valley by the legendary Master Chen. A strong ocean current once turned a wheel that drove a remarkably precise clock mechanism. Since the great earthquake — caused when the island struck a massive tendril of deep-sea Corruption — the current has slowed dramatically and the clock has stopped. The tower still stands, battered by waves, its gears frozen. It serves as silent testimony to the catastrophe that brought the Corruption to Obojima.

rooms.name: Wave-Battered Base
rooms.description: The tower rises from a platform of barnacle-crusted stone. Waves crash against the lower walls. A rusted iron door hangs ajar — beyond, stairs spiral upward. Salt water pools on the floor. Fish folk have scratched territorial marks into the stonework.

hazards.name: Covered Pit
hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section
hazards.passiveHint: The floor sounds hollow when walked on
hazards.activeHint: Seams in the dust outline a rectangular section of floor
disarmMethods: Walk along the walls where the floor is solid
Probe ahead with a 10-foot pole
Throw heavy objects to trigger it safely
hazards.consequence: The pit remains open, blocking direct passage

rooms.name: The Gear Chamber
rooms.description: A massive room dominated by Master Chen's clock mechanism — interlocking bronze gears the size of wagon wheels, frozen in place. Barnacles grow on the lower works. Fish folk have nested among the machinery, weaving seaweed shelters between the gears.

features.name: Rubble
features.description: Rubble blocks part of the room

discoveries.description: Fresh footprints in the dust suggest recent passage

rooms.name: Fish Folk Nest
rooms.description: What was once a storage level is now a fish folk nest. Salvaged nets, shells, and shiny objects are piled everywhere. They guard something hidden deep in the gearworks — a First Age component that hums with faint energy.

hazards.name: Covered Pit
hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section
hazards.passiveHint: The floor sounds hollow when walked on
hazards.activeHint: Seams in the dust outline a rectangular section of floor
disarmMethods: Walk along the walls where the floor is solid
Probe ahead with a 10-foot pole
Throw heavy objects to trigger it safely
hazards.consequence: The pit remains open, blocking direct passage

rooms.name: The Bell Chamber
rooms.description: The top of the tower. The great clock bell hangs overhead, green with verdigris. The clock face looks out over the Shallows. On certain tides, the bell tolls once on its own. The view reveals the underwater portion of the tower extending far deeper than anyone realized.

discoveries.description: The remains of an adventurer from The Seekers. Nearby: empty potion vial, rusty shortsword
discoveries.content:
Final Entry of The Seekers's Journal

We were overwhelmed by the inhabitants. If anyone finds this, tell the guild that The Seekers died fighting. The treasure... it's real. It's in the deepest chamber. Don't make our mistake - bring more people.

secrets.description: A narrow crawlway hidden by rubble

discoveries.description: Supplies have been recently disturbed

features.name: Unnatural Torches
features.description: Torches burn with an unnatural flame

discoveries.description: Fresh footprints in the dust suggest recent passage

features.name: Bone Pile
features.description: Piles of bones in the corners

trap.name: Counterweight Block
trap.description: A stone block drops when a tripwire is disturbed
trap.trigger: Walking through or disturbing the tripwire
trap.passiveHint: Fresh scratches on the ceiling directly above
trap.activeHint: A thin wire glints at ankle height across the passage
disarmMethods: Step carefully over the visible tripwire
Crawl under the wire
Cut the wire from a safe distance with a blade on a pole
trap.consequence: The crash blocks the passage until cleared (1 hour) and alerts nearby creatures

ecology.history: After the fall of the orc warlord, bandit company made this their home.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 2 turns or on loud noise

dungeonNPCs.hasInfo: Greta Doomseeker, a Wizard, leads a party of 3. They seek treasure and glory.

encounters: An AHA researcher wants to examine the clock mechanism for clues about the earthquake's true cause
Fish folk have begun nesting in the tower's lower levels — they guard something hidden in the gearworks
A Mariners' Guild diver reports the underwater portion of the tower extends much deeper than expected
On certain tides, the clock's bell tolls once — locals say it's Master Chen's ghost marking the hour

locations.name: The Way Gate
locations.description: A 120-foot tunnel bored straight through the rock face of Mount Arbora by nakudama stonemasons in the age of the monarchs. The walls and ceiling are covered in a continuous bas-relief of a royal procession through curling clouds — a testament to nakudama artistry. Large enough for a cart pulled by two horses. The Watchers patrol it, but monsters nest here when the snow piles deep outside.

rooms.name: Tunnel Mouth
rooms.description: The entrance to the Way Gate — a perfectly carved archway framing a dark passage through solid rock. Claw marks score the threshold. Cold wind flows from within.

hazards.name: Covered Pit
hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section
hazards.passiveHint: The floor sounds hollow when walked on
hazards.activeHint: Seams in the dust outline a rectangular section of floor
disarmMethods: Walk along the walls where the floor is solid
Probe ahead with a 10-foot pole
Throw heavy objects to trigger it safely
hazards.consequence: The pit remains open, blocking direct passage

secrets.description: A narrow crawlway hidden by rubble

rooms.name: Hall of the Royal Procession
rooms.description: The tunnel walls are covered in continuous nakudama bas-relief depicting a royal procession through curling clouds. Several panels have been gouged by something large. Rubble and old nests line the floor.

secrets.description: A secret door behind a tapestry

rooms.name: The Watcher's Alcove
rooms.description: A carved alcove where the Watchers keep supplies — torches, rope, dried rations. A logbook records recent monster sightings in Patcher's scrawling hand.

features.name: Rubble
features.description: Rubble blocks part of the room

discoveries.description: Fresh footprints in the dust suggest recent passage

rooms.name: Inner Gallery
rooms.description: The bas-relief here shows the nakudama queen receiving tribute. A fresh monster nest fills one corner — bones, fur, and a foul smell. Something was here recently.
historicalClues: A collapsed section shows evidence of siege weapons

rooms.name: Eastern Exit
rooms.description: Daylight filters through the far opening. The relief carvings here show the queen ascending into clouds. Bootprints in the dust suggest the Watchers patrol regularly.

discoveries.description: A locked strongbox contains rolled documents
discoveries.content:
Tattered Journal

Day 3: The goblins grow bolder. I've hidden the key where they won't find it - behind the statue in the deepest level. If I don't make it out, tell Aldric I tried.

discoveries.description: The remains of an adventurer from Companions of the Last Dawn. Nearby: cracked shield, snapped crossbow, torn leather armor
discoveries.content:
Final Entry of Companions of the Last Dawn's Journal

We were betrayed by one of their own. If anyone finds this, tell the guild that Companions of the Last Dawn died fighting. The treasure... it's real. It's in the deepest chamber. Don't make our mistake - bring more people.

trap.name: Murder Holes
trap.description: Holes in the ceiling allow defenders to rain arrows, oil, or rocks on intruders
trap.trigger: Entering the kill zone while defenders are present above
trap.passiveHint: The passage is unusually straight and narrow
trap.activeHint: Small holes line the ceiling; old oil stains darken the floor
disarmMethods: Sprint through in a single rush before they can react
Use shields overhead as a testudo formation
Find the upper chamber and clear it first
trap.consequence: Alerts the entire garrison; reinforcements arrive in 2d6 rounds

ecology.history: The dwarven clan constructed this ages past. Orc warband now prowl its halls.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 2 turns or on loud noise

encounters: Monsters have nested in the tunnel during a recent snowstorm — the Watchers need help clearing them
A section of the bas-relief has been vandalized; close inspection reveals claw marks from something large
Patcher, captain of the Watchers, regales passersby with increasingly unbelievable stories of what he's fought in this tunnel

locations.name: Lom and Salt's College of Arms
locations.description: A college of arms, training warriors and scholars.
locations.trouble: Air pirates from Lom's past establishing a stronghold nearby; sacred geothermal vents being disrupted by expansion
locations.quirk: Oldest sword school on Obojima, cut into the mountainside. The ascent itself is the first test. Students forge their own blades in the geothermal forge.

sites.name: The Golden Crown
sites.description: A well-maintained inn popular with travelers

sites.name: Town Trading Post
sites.description: A dusty emporium selling everything imaginable

sites.name: The Drunken Tankard
sites.description: A rowdy establishment known for its strong ale
sites.secret: The building sits atop an ancient tomb

rumors.text: A new face in Toggle — quiet, keeps to himself, asks a lot of questions about the Mariners' Guild.
A Toraf & Boulder student expedition sent to Polewater hasn't reported back.
The something with too many legs attacks are getting bolder. Closer to town each time.
An old map surfaced showing The Sunken Temple. The merchant who sold it was found dead the next morning.
The air pirates from lom's past establishing a stronghold nearby; sacred geothermal vents being disrupted by expansion started after Signet-Bearer Hara arrived. Coincidence? I don't believe in those.
Beatri's family says they hid something valuable before they vanished. Never found it.

notices.title: RARE METALS SOUGHT
notices.description: The forge seeks First Age alloys and unusual ores. Bring samples to Forge Keeper Duro for assessment. Top prices paid.

notices.title: HELP WANTED
notices.description: Air pirates on Mount Arbora's western slope seem to know Master Lom. They keep c... Ask around for details.

notices.title: WELL WATER ADVISORY
notices.description: The eastern well tastes strange. Avoid until tested. Use the market fountain instead.

sensoryImpressions: The hiss of quenching steel echoes up the mountain face
Geothermal vents release steam that smells faintly of iron
Distant clash of practice swords at dawn and dusk

locations.name: Ten Wheels Grove
locations.description: Once a wondrous grove of ancient bashu trees protected by the elder spirit Olundu — a giant tree sloth. Now ravaged by thick tendrils of Corruption slime. Olundu became afflicted and rotted into a demon: a shaggy, oil-covered predator with unnatural swiftness who lurks in the blackened canopy, vomiting Corruption on prey below before pouncing with terrible talons.

rooms.name: Grove Edge
rooms.description: Blackened bashu trees drip with oily Corruption slime. The canopy above is unnaturally dark. A skeletonized fish called Bloop flops around the entrance, following visitors like a lost pet.

features.name: Unnatural Torches
features.description: Torches burn with an unnatural flame

rooms.name: The Blighted Heart
rooms.description: The center of the grove where Olundu's corruption is thickest. Oil-black puddles reflect no light. Claw gouges scar the trunks ten feet up — the demon sloth prowls the canopy above.

hazards.name: Covered Pit
hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris
hazards.save: DC 12 DEX to grab the edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section

discoveries.description: Signs of a fierce battle mark this area
Parchment scraps are scattered across the floor
discoveries.content:
Crude Map

Shows a rough sketch of the dungeon, with 'DANGER' scrawled near storage room and an 'X' marking what appears to be the artifact.

discoveries.description: A sealed letter is tucked into a crack in the wall
discoveries.content:
Crude Map

Shows a rough sketch of the dungeon, with 'DANGER' scrawled near deepest level and an 'X' marking what appears to be the key.

rooms.name: Bim's Observation Post
rooms.description: A hidden lean-to where Bim of the Beasts studies the Corruption. Jars of samples, notebooks of observations, and cages of recuperating animals fill the cramped space.

ecology.history: The monstrous creature constructed this decades past. Territorial predator now prowl its halls.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 3 turns or on loud noise

exitPoints.description: A natural passage deeper into the mountain

encounters: Olundu the demon sloth lurks in the canopy above — oil drips from the branches as warning
A weird, skeletonized fish called Bloop follows the party like a stray dog through the grove
Gnasher, a wraith-like howler chieftain caught in the initial Corruption flood, haunts the grove's edge
Bim of the Beasts has a hidden observation post here, studying Corruption's effect on local wildlife

locations.name: Toraf & Boulder's School
locations.description: A school run by Torf and Bolder.
locations.trouble: Missing student expedition to Polewater; Hakumon's ramen shop under vespoma attack; masters' volatile relationship straining
locations.quirk: Sword school built from a former hunting lodge. Students train by fighting actual Wetlands monsters. Masters Toraf ('The Door') and Boulder (ex-Ranger) barely tolerate each other.

sites.name: The Jolly Tankard
sites.description: A smoky drinking hall filled with locals
sites.secret: A wanted criminal hides among the staff

sites.name: Farmer's Bazaar
sites.description: A bustling open-air market
sites.secret: A ghost haunts the upper floors

rumors.text: The Mariners' Guild is desperate to recover a stolen navigation device from the Lionfish King's warship.
The short elf woman at Murgin's Tavern knows something about the Corruption. Buy her a drink.
Join Dawn Blossom Guild? You'd have to do something to prove yourself first. Something ugly.
The dark worship at Temple of Shoom isn't abandoned. Someone - or something - has been stockpiling supplies there.
Before Uba came here, they went by a different name. The kind of name people remember.
They pulled a body from the river - covered in wounds no beast could make. He had a sketch of The Hidden Sanctum in his pocket.

notices.title: CREATURE SIGHTING REPORTS
notices.description: Rangers request all travelers report unusual creature behavior east of the Gale Fields. Leave reports at any Ranger waystation.

notices.title: CORRUPTION SAMPLES NEEDED
notices.description: Sealed samples of Corruption-tainted water or soil needed for alchemical research. Must be collected fresh. Proper containment vessels provided.

sensoryImpressions: Master Toraf's bellowing echoes across the plains
Students return from expeditions muddy and scratched but grinning
Campfire smoke rises from Boulder's wilderness camp just outside

locations.name: Crumpled Hut
locations.description: A ramshackle dwelling that looks like it was dropped from a great height and never properly rebuilt. The walls lean at impossible angles and the roof sags in the middle, yet it stands. Locals avoid it, claiming strange lights flicker inside on moonless nights and that anyone who sleeps here wakes somewhere else entirely.

rooms.name: The Crooked Doorway
rooms.description: The hut's door hangs at an impossible angle but swings open easily. Inside, the floor tilts — furniture slides slowly toward one wall. Dust motes drift upward instead of down.

features.name: Bone Pile
features.description: Piles of bones in the corners

rooms.name: The Shifted Room
rooms.description: A living space where nothing is quite right. A kettle hangs over a cold hearth but the water inside is boiling. Offerings of fish bones and river stones are arranged in a spiral on the table. A trapdoor in the floor glows faintly.

hazards.description: A 10-foot pit covered with rotting canvas and debris

hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the center of the covered section

rooms.name: Spirit Shrine Below
rooms.description: Beneath the floorboards, a cramped root cellar holds an ancient spirit shrine — a flat stone carved with spiraling glyphs that pulse with pale light. The air hums. This is why the hut moves: the shrine anchors a restless spirit that drags the structure when it wanders.

features.name: Bone Pile
features.description: Piles of bones in the corners

discoveries.description: A blood trail leads to a hidden alcove
A sealed letter is tucked into a crack in the wall

Crude Map

Shows a rough sketch of the dungeon, with 'DANGER' scrawled near eastern hall and an 'X' marking what appears to be our supplies.

ecology.history: The hedge witch abandoned this place long ago. Hag and minions moved in.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 3 turns or on loud noise

encounters: Strange lights are visible from a distance on moonless nights — investigating reveals an old spirit shrine beneath the floorboards
A traveling merchant claims the hut moved since they last passed through — their old campfire ring is now 50 feet away from it
Something has been leaving offerings of fish bones and river stones on the doorstep

locations.name: Lake Ellior
locations.description: One of Obojima's great lakes, its deep waters conceal the mostly-submerged nakudama ziggurat of Shoom. Ruins of a settlement on the southern shore hint at the site's ancient importance — Shoom was once the largest nakudama hatching site on the island, where families brought eggs to be tended by midwives. It was sealed and abandoned after the warlock Voraro the Parasite enthralled the midwives and offered eggs as tribute to his greedy spirit patron.
encounters: Lights are visible deep beneath the lake's surface at night — Voraro the Parasite and his spirit patron may still be sealed within Shoom
A nakudama pilgrim asks for escort to the southern shore ruins to perform a remembrance ritual
Corrupted fish have begun surfacing near the ziggurat — something is disturbing the ancient seals

locations.name: Tellu & Scale School
locations.description: Sword school on the northern coast of the Gift of Shuritashi.
locations.trouble: Need passage through Fish Head territory to reach Lilywin ruins; stopwatch functions remain undecoded
locations.quirk: Nomadic sword school that never stops moving. Master Tellu trains students while walking. Carries a mysterious First Age stopwatch.

sites.name: The Golden Lion
sites.description: A rustic lodge with a roaring fireplace
sites.quirk: A strange smell permeates the building

sites.name: Old Bazaar
sites.description: A lively trading square

rumors.text: Paloma Clintock has been launching increasingly reckless solo raids. Something's wrong with her.
The Lionfish King's wizard is offering a fortune to anyone who can translate ancient nakudama texts.
Whatever's in New Moon Lagoon is waking up. The ground shakes at night now.
They pulled a body from the river - covered in wounds no beast could make. He had a sketch of The Sunken Camp in his pocket.
The need passage through fish head territory to reach lilywin ruins; stopwatch functions remain undecoded has gotten worse. The council's pretending everything's fine, but it's not.
Join Tellu & Scale's School of Blades? You'd have to do something to prove yourself first. Something ugly.

notices.title: MUSHROOM WARNING
notices.description: Do NOT eat the blue-spotted mushrooms growing near the wetland edge. Three people already sick. Healer says they're Corruption-tainted.

notices.title: NIGHT WATCH VOLUNTEERS
notices.description: Strange sounds reported after dark. Town watch seeks extra eyes for the next week. Lanterns and whistles provided.

sensoryImpressions: Tent canvas flaps as the camp is struck and re-pitched daily
The rhythmic scrape of practice swords accompanies marching feet
Master Tellu's stopwatch ticks audibly in moments of silence

locations.name: The Crawling Canopy
locations.description: A mysterious, ever-moving magical forest that crawls across the Gale Fields. It may remain in one spot for months, tempting the curious — then uproot itself without warning, bewildering anyone caught inside the confounding swirl of moving trees. Most creatures live in the canopy, riding the trees as the forest lumbers across the plains. Dead wood burns longer and hotter than normal; bows of living wood are magical; arrows of living wood fly farther. Demons lurk in the depths.

rooms.name: The Tree Line
rooms.description: Where the Crawling Canopy currently rests. The trees at the edge shift and creak — roots lift and resettle like sleeping limbs. A woodcutter's dog whimpers at the boundary, refusing to enter. Fallen branches of magical living wood litter the ground.

rooms.name: The Moving Interior
rooms.description: Inside, the forest is disorienting. Trees uproot and replant around you in slow motion. The ground shifts. Navigation is nearly impossible — landmarks move. Canopy creatures watch from above: birds with too many eyes, insects that glow wrong colors.

discoveries.description: A blood trail leads to a hidden alcove
A draft of air hints at a hidden passage

rooms.name: The Demon's Hollow
rooms.description: A clearing that the trees seem to avoid. The ground is scorched. A demon lurks here — once a forest spirit, now twisted into something that feeds on the curious. Bones of woodcutters and adventurers are half-buried in the shifting soil.

secrets.description: A concealed passage in the floor

discoveries.description: A locked strongbox contains rolled documents
discoveries.content:
Crude Map

Shows a rough sketch of the dungeon, with 'DANGER' scrawled near eastern hall and an 'X' marking what appears to be the relic.

discoveries.description: Skeletal remains wearing gear from decades ago

ecology.history: Built by the nature spirit decades ago, now claimed by desecrators.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 4 turns or on desecration

dungeonNPCs.hasInfo: Yuri the Silent, a Wizard, leads a party of 2. They seek treasure and glory.

encounters: The forest has stopped moving — locals say this means it's hungry for new visitors
A desperate lumberjack offers to split profits if the party guards them while harvesting magical living wood from the edge
A woodcutter went in three days ago and hasn't returned; their dog waits at the tree line, whimpering
Arrows made from living Canopy wood add 30 feet to a bow's range — but the trees don't give up their branches willingly

locations.name: Lilywin (Ruins)
locations.description: The ancient capital of the nakudama monarchy, founded by the first Queen who swam across the great ocean to Obojima and birthed the first hundred nakudama. Lilywin once stretched for miles across the Gale Fields, but was devastated during the civil war against Oghmai the Demon Usurper. Little archaeological evidence remains — the oldest roads in the Gale Fields, still maintained by the Courier Brigade, may be the last remnants of this once-great city.
encounters: Tellu & Scale sword school is seeking passage to locate and settle at the ruins
A Courier Brigade runner reports finding carved nakudama foundation stones beneath the road surface after a recent washout
Something large is using the old road at night — enormous tracks suggest a creature from the Gale Fields
A Fish Head Coven witch offers a map to Lilywin's ceremonial center in exchange for a dangerous favor

locations.name: Blue Back Lake
locations.description: A lake at the base of Opal Falls, named for the Blue Back Salmon that migrate here annually up the River Din. The elder river spirit Din — the most beloved spirit on Obojima — long ago divided himself into thousands of salmon to feed the island. During the Salmon Festival, Din's magic lets the fish leap up the roaring falls in a burst of supernatural vigor. Locals bet on champion salmon, crown a King and Queen of the Salmon, and feast for days. The legendary 10-foot salmon Soledad is said to have fed all of Opal Falls for a week.
encounters: The Salmon Festival is approaching — volunteers needed for setup, and rumors swirl that Soledad has been spotted
A Courier Brigade member at the falls reports their post box has been broken into — someone is stealing mail
Warwick the Spirit Whisperer offers to cut gemstones in exchange for help gathering spirit-touched river stones
The blue back salmon run is late this year — fishermen fear something has disturbed Din's grotto beneath the falls

locations.name: The Shade Wood
locations.description: The section of forest near the Brackwater coastline that has been desaturated and drained of life by the Corruption. Once a living swamp, it now feels cold and empty — home to Corrupted Muk and wayward spirits slowly being twisted into demonic forms. Refugees from devastated villages huddle in a camp deep in the wood, kept alive by an exhausted ranger suffering advanced Corruption sickness and a druid working around the clock. At night, skeletonized howlers pick off the weak.

rooms.name: Dead Tree Line
rooms.description: Grey, leafless trees mark the boundary. The air is cold and tastes of iron. Corruption slime pools in the hollows between roots. Claw marks on the bark — howlers.

rooms.name: Refugee Camp
rooms.description: A desperate ring of tents and lean-tos. The druid maintains protective wards — chalk circles, herb bundles, spirit stones. The ranger lies feverish in the largest tent, Corruption veins visible on their arms.

hazards.name: Spectral Chains
hazards.description: Ghostly chains materialize and attempt to bind the living
hazards.save: DC 14 WIS to resist
hazards.trigger: Lingering in the room for more than a few moments
hazards.passiveHint: An unnatural cold settles into your bones
hazards.activeHint: Rusted chains hang from the walls; they rattle without wind
disarmMethods: Move through quickly before they fully manifest
Speak words of comfort for the dead
Pour holy water on the chain anchors
Light the room brightly with multiple light sources
hazards.consequence: Bound victims attract ghosts from nearby chambers

secrets.description: A false bottom in a chest

historicalClues: Signs of the mad wizard are visible: warped reality

rooms.name: The Rubble Golem
rooms.description: An entire collapsed village compressed into a shambling humanoid shape — timber walls for limbs, a chimney for a head. It sits motionless, making low groaning sounds. Corruption runs through its mortar like black veins. It could be cleansed or destroyed.

hazards.name: Tomb Dust
hazards.description: Disturbing the crypt releases choking ancient dust
hazards.save: DC 13 CON
hazards.trigger: Disturbing the dust by moving through the room
hazards.passiveHint: Thick dust coats everything; the air is still and stale
hazards.activeHint: Disturbing anything sends up visible clouds

rooms.description: A depression in the corrupted earth where skeletonized howlers nest during the day. Bones and scraps from their night raids litter the ground. The creatures are wraith-thin, all jaw and ribs.

rooms.name: The Turning Spirit
rooms.description: A clearing where a spirit flickers between its true form — a gentle deer-like creature — and something twisted and wrong. It begs for help in a voice like breaking glass. The transformation is nearly complete.

ecology.history: The plague-era city abandoned this place long ago. Vampire spawn moved in.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 4 turns or on desecration

encounters: Desperate Measures: A refugee camp needs immediate help — the ranger is dying of Corruption sickness and the druid can't hold the perimeter alone
It Takes a Village: An entire collapsed village has become an enormous rubble golem, confused and mourning — it could be cleansed rather than destroyed
Skeletonized howlers circle the camp each night, growing bolder as the defenders weaken
A corrupted spirit begs for help before it loses itself completely to the transformation

locations.name: Whispering Forest
locations.description: Dense, ancient woods in the Coastal Highlands where the trees seem to murmur secrets to those who listen. Young Stewards from the nearby settlements make expeditions here to study the blue back salmon migration routes and learn woodland lore. The forest edges the wild rapids of the River Din, and travelers who follow its depths eventually hear the roaring sound of Opal Falls.
encounters: Young Stewards ask for an escort on a training expedition — something has been stalking their groups
The trees' whispers have changed tone recently; locals say they sound frightened rather than welcoming
A rare blue back salmon has been spotted in a forest stream far from the river — a spirit omen

locations.name: Rumble Hill
locations.description: A large circular mound of earth near the Broken Bird Airfield. Anyone approaching hears and feels a low reverberation. The hill appears covered in soft, downy orange grass — the perfect spot to watch Phin's contraptions struggle airborne. In truth, Rumble Hill is a sleeping Cat of Prodigious Size. Once a normal house cat named Lyle, he grew continuously until mistaken for a hill. Only the loudest noises stir him. An old woman in Opal Falls still leaves a saucer of milk for him every day. A flying machine barreling down the runway would be an irresistible plaything.
encounters: Rumble Hill is purring today — the ground vibrates so strongly that drinks won't stay in cups at the airfield
Phin's latest contraption is nearly ready for a test flight, but someone warns it might wake The Hill
An elderly woman from Opal Falls arrives looking for her cat Lyle — she has a saucer of milk and refuses to believe he's a hill
The Hill has shifted position overnight, partially blocking the runway; scratch marks the size of trenches scar the earth

locations.name: New Moon Lagoon
locations.description: A sheltered lagoon in the Brackwater Wetlands where the village of Polewater perches on stilts above the water. Polewater has existed for generations as an enclave of safety between the treacherous wetlands and the sea — a tangle of interconnected gangways and catwalks running between timber structures. Once a lively marina smelling of fish and salt with guitar music drifting from returning boats. A devastating tsunami nearly destroyed it. Now fish folk grow belligerent on either side, villagers show signs of Corruption, and the young leader struggles to keep his people safe while his sister secretly embraces the Corruption.

rooms.name: Lagoon Shallows
rooms.description: Murky tidal water laps against the barnacle-crusted stilts of Polewater above. Ropes and broken fishing nets hang down like vines. Dark shapes move beneath the surface — Corruption tendrils snake through the water like living oil. At low tide, rusted First Age metalwork protrudes from the muck.

features.name: Rubble
features.description: Rubble blocks part of the room

Probe ahead with a 10-foot pole
Throw heavy objects to trigger it safely
hazards.consequence: The pit remains open, blocking direct passage

rooms.name: Sunken Marina
rooms.description: The old marina pilings descend into a graveyard of wrecked boats half-buried in silt. Fish folk territorial markers — shells and bone arranged in spirals — cover every surface. Something large has been scraping against the stilts; deep gouges scar the timber.

rooms.name: First Age Antechamber
rooms.description: A partially collapsed metal structure, ancient beyond reckoning, juts from the lagoon floor. The entrance is a corroded hatch forced open by the earthquake. Inside: smooth walls, geometric carvings, and a faint hum. Corruption seeps through cracks in the ceiling.
historicalClues: Signs of the imperial legion are visible: legion standards

rooms.name: The Drowned Vault
rooms.description: A sealed First Age chamber, knee-deep in brackish water. Strange machinery lines the walls — crystalline tubes, copper conduits green with verdigris. At the center, a circular platform holds something that pulses with dim light beneath the murk. Fish folk have been bringing offerings here.

rooms.name: Roakraska's Lair
rooms.description: The deepest point beneath the lagoon. A massive cavity carved by the tsunami's force. Here lurks Roakraska — the skeletonized gulper eel hurled inland by the wave, now nesting in the dark. Bones of fish and unfortunate divers litter the floor. This is what's been bumping the stilts at night.

Probe with a pole before stepping
Drop a weighted line to check depth
Light a torch and look for the water's movement
hazards.consequence: Connects to underwater passages; may find air pockets

Fish folk reel in skeletonized fish near the lagoon — a sign the Corruption is reaching the waters
A young woman (the leader's sister) is secretly meeting corrupted fish folk at the lagoon's edge
The old marina pilings have exposed something beneath the muck — First Age metalwork, possibly a sunken structure

locations.name: Corrupted Coastline
locations.description: The devastated eastern coast of the Brackwater Wetlands where the tsunami and earthquake struck hardest. Black pools of Corruption snake along every abandoned street and infest crumbled walls. The ruined village of Gobo sits here, home only to a single mad druid who is inexplicably immune to the Corruption — at night he claims demons overrun the town, but even he can't be sure it's not in his mind. Just offshore, the sunken village of Ekmu lies under 15 feet of corrupted water, claimed by the demon Slaathti as her lair.

rooms.name: Gobo Village Ruins
rooms.description: Crumbled stone walls and collapsed roofs line an abandoned street. Black pools of Corruption fill every hollow. A mad druid sits by a fire in the least-ruined building, muttering. He claims he's immune to the Corruption — and seems to be right.

rooms.name: The Druid's Shelter
rooms.description: The only intact building. The druid has covered the walls in chalk diagrams — maps of Corruption spread, phases of the moon, demon sightings. Some are brilliant. Some are nonsense. He can't tell the difference anymore.

features.name: Rubble
features.description: Rubble blocks part of the room

rooms.name: Bim's Laboratory
rooms.description: A makeshift workspace on the edge of the ruins. Bim of the Beasts has cages of sick animals, jars of Corruption samples, and careful notes. She needs fresh samples from deeper in the zone and will pay for them.
historicalClues: Signs of the bandit gang are visible: makeshift beds

rooms.name: The Black Shore
rooms.description: Where the land meets corrupted water. Boats bob offshore, held fast by sticky black strands anchored to the sunken village of Ekmu fifteen feet below. The demon Slaathti's eel-like form is sometimes visible in the murk.
historicalClues: Signs of the bandit gang are visible: crude repairs

rooms.name: Sunken Ekmu
rooms.description: The submerged village rests on the seafloor — stone buildings coated in Corruption. A nakudama temple sits at the center, its sacred carvings defaced. Corrupted fish folk patrol the ruins. Slaathti, a demon in giant eel form, has claimed this as her lair.

wanderingMonsters.checkFrequency: every 3 turns or on loud noise

encounters: The mad druid of Gobo offers shelter and information, but his ramblings mix truth and hallucination — separating them is the challenge
Corrupted fish folk have gathered at the sunken village of Ekmu, guarding the demon Slaathti's underwater lair
Bim of the Beasts has a makeshift laboratory on the fringe, studying Corruption's effects on animals — she needs fresh samples
Boats bob on the black water offshore, held fast by sticky strands of Corruption anchored to the sunken village below

locations.name: Domain of the Lionfish King
locations.description: The underwater domain of the Lionfish King — a pompous, moody tyrant who rules the Western Shallows with barracuda warriors and fish folk pirates. His palace, the Coral Castle, is a hill-sized coral mound flanked by poisonous anemones large enough to devour trespassers, patrolled by armored crab guardians. The hollow upper half houses his court of frogfish advisors, barracuda warriors, and noble courtiers. When not in the castle, the King rides the Doomspine — a war barge built from salvaged wrecks, its prow the stolen front half of Captain Clintock's submarine, the Pointue.
encounters: Fish folk pirates demand tribute from any vessel passing through the Shallows
The Lionfish King seeks a nakudama princess of royal bearing to marry and legitimize his rule
Corrupted deep-sea fish folk from Venomous Rex's territory are raiding westward, making the King more temperamental
The stolen submarine prow (Pointue) is mounted on the Doomspine — the Mariners' Guild desperately wants it back

hazards.name: Illusory Floor
hazards.description: The floor appears solid but is merely an illusion over empty sky
hazards.save: DC 14 WIS to disbelieve; DC 13 DEX to grab edge
hazards.trigger: Stepping onto the illusory floor section
hazards.passiveHint: The floor looks too clean; no dust, no footprints
hazards.activeHint: Your shadow doesn't fall on the floor correctly
disarmMethods: Walk only on the solid edges where walls meet floor
Probe ahead with a pole before stepping
Throw sand or flour to reveal the illusion
Dispel the illusion magically
hazards.consequence: Real walkway is 10 feet below; visible once illusion is known

hazards.name: Gravity Inversion Zone
hazards.description: Arcane enchantments cause gravity to suddenly reverse
hazards.save: DC 15 DEX to grab something
hazards.trigger: Entering the area affected by the gravity enchantment
hazards.passiveHint: Small objects float slightly; dust hangs in the air
hazards.activeHint: Scorch marks on the ceiling where others fell upward
disarmMethods: Move along the walls where gravity is stable
Tie a rope across the room before entering
Trigger the inversion while braced, then walk on the ceiling
Find and destroy the controlling rune crystal
hazards.consequence: Gravity reverses every 1d4 rounds; time your movements

dwellings.name: Cooper's Farm
dwellings.description: A modest farm with tilled fields and a weathered barn.

dwellings.name: Willow Cottage
dwellings.description: A cozy home with shuttered windows and a wooden fence.

dwellings.name: Fern Cottage
dwellings.description: A small stone dwelling nestled among the trees.

dwellings.name: Oak House
dwellings.description: A quaint cottage with a thatched roof and flower garden.

dwellings.name: Shepherd's Rest
dwellings.description: A small homestead with livestock pens and a vegetable garden.

npcs.name: Captain Clintock
npcs.description: Guild founder. Man of few words but commanding presence. Insatiably curious, driven, introspective. Currently stranded at southern lodge researching Corruption samples.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Uniform tailored to match a First Age action figure ship captain
npcs.flavorWant: Recover the Aquatic Stabilizer; find Corruption's origin point

npcs.name: Paloma Clintock
npcs.description: Captain's eldest daughter, caretaker of southern lodge. Fearless bordering on reckless. Values lodge members as closer than family. Launching solo raids into Lionfish King's domain.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Wears a magical cloak of mist; built her own catamaran the Shrike
npcs.flavorWant: Destroy the Lionfish King's hold on the Shallows
npcs.secret: Recently infected with Corruption from a fish folk dart — hasn't told anyone

npcs.name: Figby
npcs.description: Naturalist, musician, chef, and freediver extraordinaire. "The glue that keeps the lodge together." Morning dives for fish, cooks meals, plays accordion.
npcs.flavorWant: Track the rare "strobe fish"
npcs.secret: Discovered that the spirit Ogo Mo Vogo will transport trusted people to the seafloor

npcs.name: Leobini
npcs.description: Ancient navigator, Captain's closest friend. Has a thousand stories about sea monsters, brave sailors, and foolish captains. Lived at the lodge longer than anyone.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Moves with help of a crab spirit who carries him
