npcs.flavorWant: Share his thousand stories before he dies

npcs.name: Dahlia
npcs.description: Elf apprentice diver. Orphaned. Bookworm who investigates First Age objects from the Shallows. Assisting Captain Clintock with Corruption research.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Owns the island's largest action figure collection
npcs.flavorWant: Understand First Age objects from the Shallows

npcs.name: Postmaster General Miranda Escalante
npcs.description: Oversees training of every knight. Honest, forthcoming. Personally leads an elite squad dispatched to relieve imperiled couriers. "A letter isn't just a piece of paper... these things bind the island."
npcs.flavorWant: Restore full delivery service to eastern settlements; earn recognition as civil defense force

npcs.name: Gomber
npcs.description: Hard-boiled, straight-shooting detective. Part of the Brigade — tracks down mail fraud, apprehends package thieves.
npcs.flavorWant: Catch package thief Imelda

npcs.name: Lomi
npcs.description: 13-year-old boy, younger brother of Ashi (a knight). Dreams of being a postal knight. Delivered a letter to the wrong address and is desperate to fix it.
npcs.flavorWant: Fix a mis-delivered letter before his sister Ashi finds out
npcs.secret: Delivered a letter to the wrong address

npcs.name: Tatsu
npcs.description: Charismatic troublemaker with a genuine grudge against Yatamon's elite. Tags buildings with elaborate magical graffiti that tells stories.
npcs.flavorWant: Tag every Canden & Moon building; be taken seriously as a real faction

npcs.name: Mikiko
npcs.description: Witch apprentice who creates the magic ink. Secretly Fish Head trained. Torn between loyalty to the gang and fear of coven punishment. The gang's power depends entirely on her.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Young Steward; creates the magic ink
npcs.flavorWant: Protect the gang; avoid coven discovery
npcs.secret: Secretly a Fish Head Coven trainee — the coven doesn't know she's sharing magic with street kids

npcs.name: Master Canden
npcs.description: Intimidating to new students, stern teacher. Co-leader of the largest sword school.
npcs.flavorWant: Absorb or marginalize rival schools; expel Goro Goros

npcs.name: Master Moon
npcs.description: Co-master, counterbalance to Canden.
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: Instructor Venn
npcs.description: Public face of the school, runs recruitment demonstrations. Charismatic, politically savvy.
npcs.flavorWant: Secure Dawn Blossom coin recognition for the school
npcs.secret: Secretly negotiating with Dawn Blossom Guild

npcs.name: Student Captain Reiko
npcs.description: Leads the school's patrol squad that "volunteers" for city watch duty. Actually trying to catch Goro Goros taggers.
npcs.flavorWant: Catch the Goro Goros taggers; get a real fight

npcs.name: Master Tellu
npcs.description: Ancient nakudama swordmaster. Speaks in koans. Trains students while walking — the school literally never stops moving.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Stout, wide as tall; carries a First Age stopwatch with undecoded functions
npcs.flavorWant: Reach the Lilywin ruins; decode the stopwatch

npcs.name: Master Scale
npcs.description: Down-to-earth, practical teacher. Co-leader of the nomadic school.
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area

npcs.name: Wanderer Ishi
npcs.description: Former student turned recruiter. Travels ahead of the school identifying worthy candidates and safe campgrounds. Carries oral histories in her memory.
npcs.flavorWant: Find safe shelter for refugees from the east
npcs.secret: Carries oral histories in her memory

npcs.name: Mortimus Fids
npcs.description: Head Curator of the Yatamon library outpost. Rules with self-importance and snobbery. Will make adventurers grovel and ego-stroke before sharing information.
npcs.flavorWant: Be respected and deferred to

npcs.name: Dr. Zalia Frond
npcs.description: Leads the ongoing underground excavation beneath Yatamon's undercity. Affable, enthusiastic.
npcs.flavorWant: Map the ancient subway tunnels beneath Yatamon
npcs.secret: Being manipulated by Krocius to dig toward Oghmai's prison

npcs.name: Krocius
npcs.description: Posing as a Second Age scholar. Reserved, soft-spoken. Secretly steering AHA dig toward dangerous areas searching for Oghmai's prison.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Reserved, soft-spoken, lets Dr. Frond do the talking
npcs.flavorWant: Find the lost prison of ancient nakudama emperor Oghmai
npcs.secret: Using Frond and AHA to delve toward passages leading to Mount Arbora's core — the prison

npcs.name: Dini
npcs.description: Field researcher. Leads expeditions to Shoom, an abandoned Nakudama Age site.
npcs.flavorWant: Document the abandoned Nakudama Age site

npcs.name: Miss Lindley
npcs.description: Former Council member, once one of the most powerful Fish Head witches. Retired to Okiri, runs a repair shop using transmutation magic. Locals don't know she's a witch.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Accepts odd payment ("a piece of blue glass and a turnip")
npcs.flavorWant: Live quietly in Okiri
npcs.secret: Former Council of Three and Thirty member, once one of the most powerful Fish Head witches. Locals don't know she's a witch.

npcs.name: Reheni
npcs.description: Current Truffle Prince, won with piglet Gooma. Can commune with Roghora.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Current Truffle Prince; won the title with piglet Gooma
npcs.flavorWant: Commune with elder pig spirit Roghora

npcs.name: Myron
npcs.description: Lichen Sage druid of Matango. Maintains magical balance and appeases spirits.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Bark-like skin patches on his hands
npcs.flavorWant: Maintain magical balance, appease spirits

npcs.name: Chogo
npcs.description: Matsutake Gang leader. Heavyset, heart of gold, cares for waifs and strays.
npcs.flavorWant: Care for waifs and strays

npcs.name: Marvolio Chanterelle
npcs.description: Red Chanterelles majordomo. Fashionable, uncompromising visionary.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Mama Amala
npcs.description: Reishi Clan head. Mid-50s, intense yet gentle.
npcs.flavorWant: Escort travelers safely through corrupted territory
npcs.secret: Immense spiritual power

npcs.name: Madame Porcini
npcs.description: Porcini household head. Stout, friendly, known for singing.
npcs.flavorWant: Evict something living in the cellar

npcs.name: Rokoko
npcs.description: Large bipedal beetle spirit. Restaurant owner/chef at the Moss Boiler. Collects odd ingredients.
npcs.flavorWant: Collect odd ingredients

npcs.name: Broad Naldo
npcs.description: Community helper and chatterbox. Ox-like build.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

npcs.name: Thim Torrelli
npcs.description: Adventurous shepherd, joke collector, and slinger.
npcs.flavorWant: Locate a missing person last seen on the road

npcs.name: Torrio Torrelli
npcs.description: Adventurous shepherd, joke collector, and formidable slinger.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Morna
npcs.description: Child who spies on strangers. Fearless and best-informed in the village.
npcs.flavorWant: Locate a missing person last seen on the road

npcs.name: Wenneth
npcs.description: Middle-aged farmer by day, deadly sword champion by reputation.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place

npcs.name: Bree
npcs.description: Pyramid Melon-like spirit who runs the mercantile and sells potion ingredients.
npcs.flavorWant: Deliver an urgent message to a distant settlement

npcs.name: Zolde
npcs.description: Midwives leader at the Temple of Shoom. Broad build, perpetual scowl, ex-adventurer.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place
npcs.secret: Can still swing a sword

npcs.name: Voraro the Parasite
npcs.description: Ancient Warlock lurking in the deeper levels of the Temple of Shoom. Bloated, water-bound.
npcs.flavorWant: Enthrall nakudama for his patron
npcs.secret: Ancient, feeds nakudama to patron

npcs.name: Beatri
npcs.description: Midwife who went missing in the Temple of Shoom, last seen clearing the second tier.
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: Vorian
npcs.description: Humble, shy apprentice sand sculptor. True genius behind Great Ferek's fame.
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area
npcs.secret: True genius behind Great Ferek's fame

npcs.name: Ulmat
npcs.description: Pearl's omenspeaker and art lover. Tallest in the Gift with an otherworldly voice.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Tallest in the Gift; otherworldly voice
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: Gritty Groff
npcs.description: Sand Witch who protects the pearl. Lives with giant sand fleas Fleck & Speck.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Lives with giant sand fleas Fleck & Speck
npcs.flavorWant: Track down someone who owes a significant debt

npcs.name: Kenta
npcs.description: Beachcomber kid who lives in a buried ship with his brothers.
npcs.flavorWant: Find a cure for a friend's mysterious illness

npcs.name: Kaz
npcs.description: Beachcomber kid who lives in a buried ship with his brothers.
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: Kersh
npcs.description: Beachcomber kid and warlock with a puffer-fish spirit patron.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds

npcs.name: Harraga
npcs.description: Blind healer acolyte with a sweet tooth.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds

npcs.name: Eol
npcs.description: Burly, bald acolyte obsessed with keeping everything clean.
npcs.flavorWant: Keep everything clean

npcs.name: Kem
npcs.description: Loud, friendly acolyte accompanied by black cat spirit Boog.
npcs.flavorWant: Find safe shelter for refugees from the east

npcs.name: Master of Ceremonies
npcs.description: Tall, gangly, dancing spirit who hosts the market. Never sleeps. Sends his own shadow on errands.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Tall, gangly, dancing; large eyebrows; never sleeps
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Emille the Busker
npcs.description: Melancholic musician bound to a spirit patron inside his pluckerine instrument. Plays compulsively.
npcs.flavorWant: Freedom from compulsory playing

npcs.name: Throth with Eyes Everywhere
npcs.description: Market constable — a collective of floating eyes that beams light when spotting violations.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Collective of floating eyes; beams light when spotting violations
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

npcs.name: Humble Utzu
npcs.description: Tiny spirit with a black flame head. Smuggler and con artist who refers to himself in third person.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Tiny with black flame head; refers to self in third person
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

npcs.name: The Four Orbles
npcs.description: Identical small spirits, nimble tumblers who catch magical fish with butterfly nets.
npcs.flavorWant: Deliver an urgent message to a distant settlement

npcs.name: Dapo Dapo
npcs.description: Two spirits, both named Dapo. Fish paste masters who are touchy about their craft.
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area
npcs.secret: Secretly resent each other

npcs.name: Vymm
npcs.description: Spider-like spirit healer who cocoons patients in webbing. Assisted by small rock spirit Vigor.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place
npcs.secret: Serves nefarious clients

npcs.name: Ferryman
npcs.description: Stocky, headless ferry operator. Wears a fish necklace whose fish heads speak for him.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Stocky, headless; wears fish necklace, fish heads speak
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area

npcs.name: Cholly
npcs.description: Pelican spirit trolley conductor. Wears a conductor's cap. Scatterbrained but enthusiastic.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds

npcs.name: Granny Yuzu
npcs.description: First Age relic collector who lives among yuzu trees, guarded by spirit mastiff Tibor.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

npcs.name: Imelda
npcs.description: Notorious package thief who leaves a calling card. Accompanied by Choofi, a floating fur-covered spirit that discerns objects by smell.
npcs.flavorWant: Steal increasingly audacious targets

npcs.name: Master Hu
npcs.description: Guru-like baker at the Happy Joy Cake Bakery. Accompanied by Bokka Bokka, a jolly chicken spirit tour guide.
npcs.flavorWant: Make cakes

npcs.name: Mr. Basingstoke
npcs.description: Intimidating Warlock who runs the Witchery, a witch academy. Unaffiliated with any coven. Accompanied by Sorrow, a large disturbing octopus spirit.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Lula
npcs.description: Spirit who freely travels between realms. Has been in Yatamon for centuries. Runs a diner and gambling hall.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Freely travels between realms; been in Yatamon for centuries
npcs.flavorWant: Find entertainment for the upcoming festival

npcs.name: Bridge Cat
npcs.description: Giant sleeping spirit under a bridge in Yatamon. One of Obojima's great mysteries.
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area
npcs.secret: Brings longevity and peace. One of Obojima's great mysteries.

npcs.name: Gojo
npcs.description: Ramen chef who admires but deeply resents rival Hakumon.
npcs.flavorWant: Beat Hakumon; restore wounded pride
npcs.secret: Willing to cheat to beat Hakumon

npcs.name: Himitsu
npcs.description: Anomalous spirit who runs the Arcane Izakaya — a tavern that vanishes during the day. Alters form.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Alters form; tavern vanishes during day
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family recipe stolen by a rival

npcs.name: Jenni
npcs.description: Witch who runs a general store and sells potion ingredients. Bosses brothers Hop & Jib. Loves adventure stories.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Bosses brothers Hop & Jib; loves adventure stories
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

npcs.name: Whiskers
npcs.description: Caramel spirit cat who lost his voice. Needs a chattershroom to restore it.
npcs.flavorWant: Needs a chattershroom to restore voice (lost to Witch Meg Wicklowe)

npcs.name: Holly Clintock
npcs.description: Captain's younger daughter. Gifted engineer and shipwright. Optimistic, sense of wonder, prefers workshop work to people. Designed the current Pointue and diving suits. Lionfish King's #1 target.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Always has useful tools hanging from her belt, talks to them like old friends
npcs.flavorWant: Finish hull patch for the Pointue; complete the new ship Windward

npcs.name: Marcel
npcs.description: Blind lighthouse keeper at Pelican's Nest. Navigates using Holly's modified First Age fish finder (sonar rig). Accompanied by pelican spirit Disaster.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Broad-shouldered, tall, thick mustache, blind; tattooed arms depicting mythical marine life
npcs.flavorWant: Keep the lighthouse running and Holly safe

npcs.name: Chisuay
npcs.description: Slender, dashing Tea Master. Charismatic, pompous. An oni sorcerer in human guise who struggles with his oni nature.
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area
npcs.secret: Oni sorcerer in human guise; struggles with oni nature

npcs.name: Migo
npcs.description: Six-armed teahouse helper who doesn't speak, communicating only through sign language.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Six-armed; doesn't speak, uses sign language
npcs.flavorWant: Track down someone who owes a significant debt

npcs.name: Indigo
npcs.description: Awakened fossa who serves as staff majordomo. Stuffy and self-important, pushes his weight around when Chisuay is absent.
npcs.flavorWant: Push weight around when Chisuay is absent

npcs.name: Adira
npcs.description: Master healer and herbalist who runs the apothecary at Hogstone. Short, calm, intense presence. Accompanied by spirit Mocha.
npcs.flavorWant: Find safe shelter for refugees from the east

npcs.name: Jollah Everbreeze
npcs.description: Bard who plays "numinous groove" through a wind instrument inhabited by a spirit.
npcs.flavorWant: Find a cure for a friend's mysterious illness

npcs.name: Rockwell "Rock" Raley
npcs.description: Consummate aeronaut with infectious energy, easy charm, and simmering ambition.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Infectious energy, easy charm, simmering ambition
npcs.flavorWant: Retrieve something dropped in a dangerous area
npcs.secret: Claims to have met The Sky King

npcs.name: Councilor Jiko
npcs.description: Oldest of five council leaders in Sky Kite. Hotheaded and brash, wants to stop the aeronauts.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Oldest of five council leaders; hotheaded, brash
npcs.flavorWant: Stop the aeronauts

npcs.name: Olaya
npcs.description: Small serpentine spirit muse. Transparent, becomes opaque when feeding. Asks the right questions to spark creativity.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Small serpentine spirit; transparent, opaque when feeding
npcs.flavorWant: Deliver an urgent message to a distant settlement

npcs.name: Louise
npcs.description: Master kite maker with unrivaled expertise. Ex-partner of Rock, who abandoned her in the Crawling Canopy.
npcs.flavorWant: Deliver an urgent message to a distant settlement
npcs.secret: Ex-partner of Rock, abandoned in Crawling Canopy

npcs.name: Marlon
npcs.description: Exceedingly lazy Warden of Barges who grumbles nonstop while overseeing the locks.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Rufus
npcs.description: Co-owner of The Waterline pub with his sister Mal. Nearly went bankrupt before the kite boom.
npcs.flavorWant: Evict something living in the cellar

npcs.name: Mal
npcs.description: Co-owner of The Waterline pub with her brother Rufus.
npcs.flavorWant: Evict something living in the cellar

npcs.name: Ember
npcs.description: Friendliest kitemonger in Sky Kite. Rents kites and teaches novices. Known for closing shop to personally help customers.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

npcs.name: Master Lom
npcs.description: Rough exterior, demanding instructor. Co-leader of the oldest martial institution on Obojima.
npcs.flavorWant: Forge a legendary blade; re-establish school dominance

npcs.name: Master Salt
npcs.description: Grim-faced master with exacting standards. Co-leader of the oldest sword school.
npcs.flavorWant: Obtain First Age metallurgy manuals

npcs.name: Forge-Keeper Duro
npcs.description: Master smith at the geothermal forge. Obsessed with First Age alloy compositions. Will talk anyone's ear off about metallurgy.
npcs.flavorWant: Obtain First Age alloy compositions

npcs.name: Garo
npcs.description: Master smith who works with brother Duro forging specialized alloys.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place

npcs.name: Isabel Skiff
npcs.description: High-society AHA member stationed at Toggle. Hunting for a rare gemstone called a dragon's fist. Sticks out among miners but earnest about rolling up her sleeves.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Well-funded, dapper clothes that stick out among miners
npcs.flavorWant: Find a rare gemstone called a dragon's fist

npcs.name: Nuharo
npcs.description: 14-year-old disguised as old Wizard Grimcloak. Cloud Cap Coven apprentice who reverses curses and hexes. Nobody knows Grimcloak is a Cloud Cap witch.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: 14 years old; disguised as an old Wizard named Grimcloak
npcs.flavorWant: Intercept and decode Mount Arbora peak signals
npcs.secret: Nobody knows Grimcloak is a Cloud Cap witch — or a 14-year-old girl

npcs.name: Root
npcs.description: Herb gatherer who tends the high-altitude gardens. Trades rare mountain fungi with travelers. Cheerful but evasive about coven matters.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Cheerful but evasive about coven matters
npcs.flavorWant: Tend the high-altitude gardens

npcs.name: Phent
npcs.description: Village elder with a warm folksy manner who campaigns against spirit encroachments.
npcs.flavorWant: Campaign against spirit "encroachments"
npcs.secret: Keeps a bound corrupted spirit; plans to release it in Toggle

npcs.name: Stout Crumm
npcs.description: Silent ex-Ranger who communicates via slate. First person to encounter the Corruption.
npcs.flavorWant: Find a cure for a friend's mysterious illness

npcs.name: Patcher
npcs.description: Boisterous Watchers captain and teller of tall tales.
npcs.flavorWant: Escort travelers safely through corrupted territory
npcs.secret: Possesses Rod of Awakening

npcs.name: Jeelah
npcs.description: One of the best rockwinder climbers at Jumaga's Roost.
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: Karmajin
npcs.description: Least scrupulous rockwinder at Jumaga's Roost. Willing to exploit Jumaga.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing
npcs.secret: Willing to exploit Jumaga

npcs.name: Johnny One-Eye
npcs.description: Miner and adventurer in Toggle. Missing one eye. Inseparable from spirit companion Thugg.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Signet-Bearer Hara
npcs.description: Senior student who carries Lom & Salt's challenge signet. Travels to other schools delivering formal tournament invitations.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place
npcs.secret: Secretly admires Tellu & Scale's philosophy

npcs.name: Yolikanter Crogiss
npcs.description: Council Witch. Paranoid, specializes in warding magic. "It's easier to catch a wandering door than to catch Yolikanter by surprise."
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Paranoid, almost always at the Witches' Bridge
npcs.flavorWant: Locate the 5 remaining Almanac volumes

npcs.name: Bim of the Beasts
npcs.description: Council Witch. Enigmatic. Speaks only through animals — never her own voice. Almost always at the Witches' Bridge.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Speaks ONLY through animals — never uses her own voice
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing
npcs.secret: Unknown age

npcs.name: Brass Eyes
npcs.description: Council Witch. Tiny, withered. Eyes replaced with brass orbs. Often unclear if he's talking to you or to unseen spirits.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Tiny, withered; eyes replaced with brass orbs
npcs.flavorWant: Locate a missing person last seen on the road
npcs.secret: Said to live simultaneously in both Physical and Spirit Realm. No living witch knows his real name.

npcs.name: Tan the Apprentice
npcs.description: Newcomer apprentice (13). Apprentices for renowned Witch Ognev. Awkward kid who appears to talk to himself — actually speaking to invisible spirit companion Abi.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: 13 years old; appears to talk to himself (actually talking to invisible Abi)
npcs.flavorWant: Learn to be a spirit medium; explore at night
npcs.secret: Sneaks out at night; has a trinket stash at a serpent standing stone

npcs.name: Ognev
npcs.description: Renowned Witch. Recognized Tan's gift when everyone else thought he was just a weird kid.
npcs.flavorWant: Find safe shelter for refugees from the east

npcs.name: Ermy Flower
npcs.description: Runs ingredient kiosk cart below the Witching Tower's lowest bridge. Personable, chatty, loves talking about the best places to eat.
npcs.flavorWant: Talk about the best places to eat on the island

npcs.name: Alkun
npcs.description: Resident Witch with connections to elder spirit Sorolu (made of earth and vines). Desperately seeking help healing it from unknown malady.
npcs.flavorWant: Heal the elder spirit Sorolu from its unknown malady

npcs.name: Edgarton Hargreaves III
npcs.description: Self-appointed spokesman. Wears seven hats. Speaks in riddles that occasionally contain genuine cosmic truths.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Wears seven hats stacked on his head
npcs.flavorWant: Complete the "cosmic calculations"; determine if buried thing is weapon or machine

npcs.name: Penelope Mibblethorpe
npcs.description: Eccentric witch member of the Council of Kroo.
npcs.flavorWant: Escort travelers safely through corrupted territory

npcs.name: Sheldrake Wobbledrain
npcs.description: Eccentric warlock member of the Council of Kroo.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place

npcs.name: Thurston Smorkwaggle
npcs.description: "External affairs minister." Actually just wanders the Gale Fields muttering. Accidentally gives useful directions. Carries floppy disks he calls "the keys."
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Carries a bag of floppy disks he calls "the keys"
npcs.flavorWant: Find safe shelter for refugees from the east
npcs.secret: Accidentally gives useful directions to lost travelers

npcs.name: Zeb
npcs.description: Scavenger and explorer in the Crawling Canopy. Part of a trio with Jeb and Dingus.
npcs.flavorWant: Find safe shelter for refugees from the east

npcs.name: Jeb
npcs.description: Scavenger and explorer in the Crawling Canopy. Part of a trio with Zeb and Dingus.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Dingus
npcs.description: Scavenger and explorer in the Crawling Canopy. Part of a trio with Zeb and Jeb.
npcs.flavorWant: Deliver an urgent message to a distant settlement

npcs.name: Morgo
npcs.description: Sage spirit sent into the Crawling Canopy 20 years ago. Never came back. Alive, still searching, losing his mind.
npcs.flavorWant: Find evidence of where Oghmai was imprisoned
npcs.secret: Sent into the Canopy 20 years ago. Deep Current doesn't know if he's dead, lost, or swallowed.

npcs.name: Warden Ashka
npcs.description: Field commander, eastern Corruption front. Makes brutal triage decisions daily. Trusted by Toraf & Boulder but hiding the true casualty count.
npcs.flavorWant: Cure infected rangers; push Corruption boundary back
npcs.secret: Hiding the true casualty count from island leadership

npcs.name: Scout Fennel
npcs.description: Fastest scout in the wetlands. Runs messages between Ranger outposts and Toraf & Boulder's school. Young, idealistic, not yet infected.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Fastest scout in the wetlands; carries hand-drawn Corruption spread maps
npcs.flavorWant: Stay alive and uninfected

npcs.name: Master Toraf
npcs.description: Barking teaching style, no-nonsense. Co-leader of the only school with real monster-fighting experience.
npcs.flavorWant: Reinforcements from other factions

npcs.name: Master Boulder
npcs.description: Enormous, speaks in short sentences, judges people by what they do not what they say. Personally leads patrols into corrupted territory.
npcs.flavorWant: Hold the line until Rangers find a cure

npcs.name: Quartermaster Jig
npcs.description: Manages supplies and salvage from a nearby submerged First Age garage. Scrounges everything — wrenches, ratchets, car jacks repurposed as training equipment.
npcs.flavorWant: Keep the school supplied

npcs.name: Crow Mother Vex
npcs.description: Coven leader. Surrounded by a permanent murder of crows. Gaunt, intense, hasn't slept properly in months.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Gaunt, intense; surrounded by a permanent murder of crows
npcs.flavorWant: Brew a reliable Corruption-resistance potion; obtain underwater samples from Mariners' Guild
npcs.secret: Hasn't slept properly in months

npcs.name: Brewer Thistle
npcs.description: Potion specialist experimenting with Corruption-resistance brews. Test subjects include herself — left arm has a faint dark sheen she hides.
npcs.flavorWant: Perfect the Corruption-resistance brew (current success: ~40%)
npcs.secret: Her left arm has a faint dark sheen she hides under long sleeves — partially corrupted from self-testing

npcs.name: Ermina Flopfoot
npcs.description: Crowsworn witch who has independently studied Oghmai texts. Believes Madelaine suffers from the same sickness that turned Oghmai into a demon. Deep Current watches her research.
npcs.flavorWant: Help Madelaine (believes she has same sickness that turned Oghmai into a demon)
npcs.secret: Has independently studied Oghmai texts. The Deep Current is watching her research closely.

npcs.name: Ernest Ebbs
npcs.description: Reluctant leader of the corrupted coastline survivors.
npcs.flavorWant: Track down someone who owes a significant debt

npcs.name: Madelaine
npcs.description: Survivor who underwent a transformation/ordeal with the Corruption. Now accompanied by spirit companion Silt who saved her.
npcs.flavorWant: Escort travelers safely through corrupted territory
npcs.secret: Deep Current watches her — Ermina believes she has the same sickness that turned Oghmai into a demon

npcs.name: Grifftang Crump
npcs.description: Resident of Polewater Village, affected by Corruption aftermath.
npcs.flavorWant: Gather rare ingredients from a hard-to-reach place

npcs.name: Gomura
npcs.description: Monstrous elder spirit lurking in Polewater's ruined subway. Disturbed from slumber.
npcs.flavorWant: Locate a missing person last seen on the road

npcs.name: Hakumon
npcs.description: Imposing ramen master who has embraced his oni form and found peace with humanity. Accompanied by Scrublings, small helper spirits.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Imposing; embraced oni form; at peace with humanity
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: Mr. Noka Noka
npcs.description: Notorious doppelganger who frequents Hakumon's Ramen Shop.
npcs.flavorWant: Escort travelers safely through corrupted territory

npcs.name: Audok
npcs.description: Kohdoi elder and respected leader of Roa Kala.
npcs.flavorWant: Recover a family heirloom from a dangerous ruin

npcs.name: Myara
npcs.description: Artisan of exceptional talent in Roa Kala.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds

npcs.name: Joshi
npcs.description: Young dara who never connected with traditional dara ways.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds
npcs.secret: Never connected with traditional dara ways

npcs.name: Poli
npcs.description: Ranger and grove keeper protecting Roa Kala.
npcs.flavorWant: Deliver an urgent message to a distant settlement

npcs.name: Uba
npcs.description: Chief Archivist. Stays at HQ overseeing the Archive. Teacher mentality, believes everyone can contribute worthy ideas.
npcs.flavorWant: Share knowledge with genuinely interested visitors
npcs.secret: Once let a charlatan scholar steal a tome detailing Mount Arbora cave networks

npcs.name: Gurriko
npcs.description: Archaeologist of the Asloh. Interested in ancient building techniques.
npcs.flavorWant: Understand First Age construction methods

npcs.name: Loninni
npcs.description: Historian of the Asloh. From Mount Arbora foothills.
npcs.flavorWant: Document pre-First Age history

npcs.name: Lonzo
npcs.description: Grizzled, grumbly, oldest AHA member. Spends time alone at the telescope, nodding off occasionally. Keeps a First Age radio that emits mysterious war dispatches.
npcs.flavorWant: Decode the mysterious radio "war dispatches"
npcs.secret: A First Age radio he keeps emits white noise interrupted by garbled language snippets he claims are "dispatches about some war"

npcs.name: Chloe
npcs.description: Wizard obsessed with First Age technology. Specialty: cassette players. Avid collector of First Age music — the louder, the better.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Workshop full of partially assembled devices and scattered tools
npcs.flavorWant: Collect more First Age music (louder = better)

npcs.name: Wayla
npcs.description: River Master at Opal Falls. Oversees boat traffic and toll collection. Runs two gangs of dockworkers operating water-powered elevators.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Proudly tells everyone the very first postal box was established at the falls
npcs.flavorWant: Honor the legacy of the first postal box

npcs.name: Phin
npcs.description: Obsessed with First Age aviation. Will talk about biplanes until you physically leave. Reckless but lovable.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Battered flight jacket with faded insignia; lives in the control tower
npcs.flavorWant: Achieve powered flight; fly to the Vanishing Mountain
npcs.secret: Was once an AHA member — left to pursue flight obsession. Considers the airfield tech archive his personal treasure.

npcs.name: Mechanic Gretta
npcs.description: Keeps the airfield's machinery running. Built a working glider from scavenged parts. Pragmatic counterweight to Phin's dreams.
npcs.flavorWant: Keep the airfield machinery running
npcs.secret: Secretly believes powered flight is impossible without First Age spirits

npcs.name: Warwick
npcs.description: Spirit whisperer and mediator between realms at Opal Falls.
npcs.flavorWant: Purify a corrupted shrine in the wilderness

npcs.name: Liffi Bolo
npcs.description: Village elder and community leader of Opal Falls.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds

npcs.name: Mazuka Bo
npcs.description: Reclusive druid at Opal Falls.
npcs.flavorWant: Purify a corrupted shrine in the wilderness

npcs.name: Plitsu
npcs.description: Adorable little spectral spirit who serves as the airfield guardian and mascot.
npcs.flavorWant: Clear vermin from a building or mine

npcs.name: The Lionfish King
npcs.description: Self-proclaimed monarch. Pompous, moody, vain, egotistical — but not a psychopath. Can be reasoned with if skewed in his favor. Rules by bullying and guile.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Bristling mane of spines that betrays his mood
npcs.flavorWant: Marry a nakudama royal descendant for legitimacy; destroy Captain Clintock
npcs.secret: Fearful of the Corruption encroaching on his reef

npcs.name: Sleethar
npcs.description: Moray eel royal consigliere and ocean mage. Fears his lord, under constant pressure to crack the Royal Lineages. Cowardly but shrewd and cunning.
npcs.flavorWant: Crack the Royal Lineages code before the King executes him
npcs.secret: Could be turned into an ally if approached carefully

npcs.name: Bloodfin the Foul
npcs.description: Exiled female fish folk captain. Leads a pirate band from a sunken First Age town. Desperately wants back into the King's good graces. Could rejoin King or defect to Venomous Rex.
npcs.flavorWant: Get back into the King's good graces
npcs.secret: Being manipulated by sea hag Slurpgill who wants to turn her into a hag

npcs.name: Morris
npcs.description: Giant seahorse spirit. Cowardly, intimidated into serving Bloodfin. Terrified of Slurpgill. Hangs out in a sunken First Age music store.
npcs.flavorWant: Survive
npcs.secret: Will lie to or tattle on outsiders to save himself

npcs.name: Lucinda
npcs.description: Awakened giant octopus, gentle creature. Bloodfin holds her eggs hostage in a giant clam, forcing Lucinda to act as junkyard dog.
npcs.flavorWant: Free her eggs from Bloodfin's giant clam

npcs.name: Slurpgill
npcs.description: Sea hag, shadow power over Bloodfin's exile band. All water spirits tremble at her name. Designed as a recurring underwater nemesis.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Sea hag form; all water spirits tremble at her name
npcs.flavorWant: Build a coven by turning Bloodfin into a hag
npcs.secret: Lair location unknown

npcs.name: The Venomous Rex
npcs.description: Commands corrupted fish folk from the deep east. Pressures Lionfish King from the opposite side of the Corruption front.
npcs.flavorWant: Encroach on Lionfish King's territory
npcs.secret: Forces corrupted by the Corruption

npcs.name: Vutochi
npcs.description: Foremost expert on the Corruption. Appears as a cat spirit but transforms into a tall imposing mage in the Spirit Realm. Searches the eastern coastline for surviving fish.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Dispassionate air, enters trances; cat form in Physical Realm, tall imposing mage in Spirit Realm
npcs.flavorWant: Find fish that escaped skeletonization from the Corruption
npcs.secret: Exists simultaneously in both Physical and Spirit Realm

npcs.name: The Assessor
npcs.description: Masked figure who appears at markets to evaluate currency circulation. No one knows their real identity. Speaks formally, never makes small talk.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Masked; carries a First Age coin-pressing stamp
npcs.flavorWant: Maintain currency stability
npcs.secret: True identity unknown to everyone

npcs.name: Mint-Keeper Pollu
npcs.description: Oversees a hidden minting facility. Friendly with merchants, trades gossip for ingredient leads.
npcs.distinguishingFeature: Only person who openly admits working for Dawn Blossom
npcs.flavorWant: Secure ingredient leads through gossip

npcs.name: The Conductor
npcs.description: High-strung, fussy spirit who conducts the Wandering Line train.
npcs.flavorWant: Track down someone who owes a significant debt

npcs.name: The Coal Master
npcs.description: Enigmatic spirit who handles the Wandering Line's power source — Spirit Coal.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate strange sounds coming from the wilds

npcs.name: Salazar Sales
npcs.description: Refreshment vendor aboard the Wandering Line.
npcs.flavorWant: Locate a missing shipment lost in the wetlands

npcs.name: Montague P. Parrot
npcs.description: Anthropomorphic parrot spirit who rides the Wandering Line as a passenger.
npcs.flavorWant: Investigate why shipments keep going missing

factions.name: Mariners' Guild
factions.description: Undersea explorers guild with four lodges at compass points. Led by Captain Clintock and his daughters Holly and Paloma. Locked in a decades-long blood feud with the Lionfish King over the Aquatic Stabilizer.
factions.purpose: Explore the deep ocean, find the Corruption's source, recover the Aquatic Stabilizer

advantages.name: The Pointue Submarine
advantages.description: Damaged First Age submarine in drydock at the southern lodge

advantages.name: Deep-Water Expertise
advantages.description: Diving suits, fish finder/sonar tech, deep-water expertise

advantages.name: Corruption Research
advantages.description: Corruption research samples and underwater survey data

advantages.name: Four Lodges
advantages.description: Four lodges at compass points give island-wide coastal presence

advantages.name: Navigation Beacons
advantages.description: Salvaged First Age navigation beacons still pulsing with magic

agenda.description: Gather enough Corruption samples from the Shallows to identify the source
Convince AHA to share First Age submarine schematics for repair
Repair the Pointue's hull and navigation systems
Recover the Aquatic Stabilizer from the Lionfish King's Doomspine
Launch a deep-water expedition to find the Corruption's origin point

obstacle.description: The Aquatic Stabilizer is mounted on the Lionfish King's flagship Doomspine. Holly is the only engineer who can repair the sub, but she's at the northern lodge while the Pointue sits in drydock at the southern lodge — and the Lionfish King's patrols make transport between them extremely dangerous.

immediateObstacle.description: Paloma Clintock has been secretly infected with the Corruption from a fish folk dart. She hasn't told anyone and continues launching reckless solo raids. The infection is progressing.

factions.want: The Aquatic Stabilizer. They'd also accept AHA's help reverse-engineering a replacement, but AHA wants underwater ruin access in return. Take down the Lionfish King.
factions.tension: Lionfish King sank the original Pointue and took the Stabilizer. Clintock got the King imprisoned in Uluwa. Decades-long blood feud. Neither will negotiate directly — players make ideal intermediaries.

relationships.reason: Blood feud over the Aquatic Stabilizer
Natural partnership — competing priorities
Corruption cure research

factions.name: The Lionfish King
factions.description: Self-proclaimed monarch of the Western Shallows. Pompous, vain fish folk ruler who commands an underwater kingdom from the Coral Castle. Desperately seeks royal legitimacy through a marriage alliance with a nakudama royal heir.
factions.purpose: Legitimize his rule through royal marriage, destroy Captain Clintock, expand his territory

advantages.name: Shallows Army
advantages.description: Elite crab sentinels, barracuda warriors, fish folk pirates

advantages.name: The Doomspine
advantages.description: War barge with Aquatic Stabilizer mounted in stolen Pointue prow

advantages.name: Coral Castle
advantages.description: Underwater fortress in the Shallows

advantages.name: Royal Lineages
advantages.description: Two ancient tomes tracking the nakudama royal bloodline

advantages.name: Boombox the Octopus
advantages.description: Crimson octopus that produces priceless magical ink

advantages.name: King of the Shallows
advantages.description: Self-proclaimed king, feared by coastal settlements

agenda.description: Hire surface-dweller mercenaries to assassinate Holly Clintock
Decipher the Royal Lineages to identify a living nakudama royal heir
Locate the heir and arrange a marriage alliance (willing or not)
Hold a coronation ceremony legitimizing his rule in the spirit realm
Destroy Captain Clintock and sink whatever's left of his fleet
Expand territory from the Shallows into coastal waters

obstacle.description: The Royal Lineages are written in cryptic nakudama code. His wizard Sleethar has failed to crack it. He needs AHA's translation expertise but can't approach surface-dwellers openly. Venomous Rex's corrupted deep-sea fish folk encroach from the east, forcing him to fight on two fronts.

immediateObstacle.description: Bloodfin the Foul, his exiled captain, is being corrupted by the sea hag Slurpgill who is grooming Bloodfin to become a hag and defect to Venomous Rex. The King doesn't know about Slurpgill's involvement.

factions.want: A scholar who can decipher the Royal Lineages. Would trade almost anything except the Aquatic Stabilizer or the octopus.
factions.tension: Has what Mariners' Guild desperately needs (Stabilizer). Needs what AHA has (translation). Dawn Blossom needs his octopus ink for currency. Venomous Rex pressures from the east. Some vassals are secretly friendly to Clintock's daughters.

relationships.reason: Blood feud — stole the Stabilizer
Needs their translation but can't ask openly
Controls octopus ink Dawn Blossom needs

factions.name: Archaeologists, Historians & Archivists
factions.description: Academic guild operating from a 19-level observatory in the southeastern Coastal Highlands. Maintains the island's largest First Age tech archive and field research teams at a dozen excavation sites. Spread dangerously thin.
factions.purpose: Preserve and study First Age knowledge, research the Corruption, explore the Wandering Line subway network
factions.region: Island-wide (dozen+ field sites), HQ in southeastern Coastal Highlands

advantages.name: First Age Archive
advantages.description: Largest First Age tech archive — computers, floppy disks, arcade cabinets, radios, VHS tapes, cassette players

advantages.name: Translation Expertise
advantages.description: Translation expertise for First Age languages and codes; deciphered much of First Age language

advantages.name: Field Research Network
advantages.description: Field research teams at dozen+ excavation sites; ~20 staff at Yatamon library outpost; chronicler spirits

advantages.name: Observatory HQ
advantages.description: 19-level observatory HQ with telescope, labs, archive, curio museum; Yatamon library outpost

advantages.name: First Age Stockpile
advantages.description: First Age canned food stockpile, preserved artifacts, refurbished telescope

agenda.description: Explore the ancient subway tunnels beneath Yatamon — Dr. Frond's dig is pushing deeper into the undercity
Discover where the Wandering Line goes and what its depot network connects to
Research the Corruption — housing infected rangers, studying skeletonized fish, losing researchers to exposure
Investigate the stellar anomaly — constellations have shifted, star movements are slowing
Gain access to underwater ruins via Mariners' Guild submarine
Decode Lonzo's mysterious radio 'war dispatches'
Find the Disappearing Mountain

obstacle.description: Spread too thin. Field researchers falling ill from Corruption exposure. The most critical underwater ruins require the Mariners' Guild submarine, but the Guild demands Corruption research help first. Yatamon subway dig keeps hitting collapsed tunnels and dangerous creatures.

immediateObstacle.description: The flooded lowest levels of AHA headquarters have been discovered and occupied by corrupted viperfish folk loyal to Venomous Rex. They're actively looking for a way into the upper floors. AHA has no idea they're down there.

factions.want: Underwater First Age ruin access (Mariners' Guild has it). The Royal Lineages (Lionfish King has them). Safe passage through subway tunnels. Answers about the Wandering Line depot network.
factions.tension: Natural partnership with Mariners' Guild but competing priorities. Could be kingmaker in the Lionfish King conflict. Krocius is secretly using Frond's dig to hunt for the Prison of Oghmai. Viperfish folk have infiltrated the flooded HQ basement.

relationships.reason: Natural partnership, competing priorities
Could trade translation services but would legitimize a tyrant
Phin was once AHA, wants to keep airfield tech to himself
Lom & Salt want metallurgy manuals from the archive
Krocius secretly steering digs toward Oghmai's prison

factions.name: Fish Head Coven
factions.description: The most powerful witch coven on Obojima, operating from the Witching Tower in the Gale Fields. Led by the Council of Three and Thirty. Seeks total monopoly over magical ingredient knowledge through the seven Almanac volumes.
factions.purpose: Collect all seven Almanac volumes and achieve total monopoly over magical ingredient knowledge

advantages.name: Almanac Volumes
advantages.description: 2 of 7 Almanac volumes (Gale Fields & Shallows), cassette tape spell scrolls

advantages.name: Cassette Spellcasting
advantages.description: First Age cassette players repurposed as spellcasting foci

advantages.name: Witch Network
advantages.description: Dozens of affiliated witches embedded across island; chot-to spy statues in the Sanctum

advantages.name: The Closed Fists
advantages.description: Twin vaults: Northern = bulk ingredient stores guarded by urugama demons. Southern = most dangerous magic items, mushroom cage defenses

advantages.name: The Sanctum
advantages.description: Secret underground cavern with hundreds of chot-to statues storing spells, events, and ingredient recipes

advantages.name: Coven Supremacy
advantages.description: Most powerful coven — others defer or resent them. Help run the Witchery academy in Yatamon

agenda.description: Locate the covens holding the remaining 5 Almanac volumes
Acquire volumes through trade, trickery, or intimidation — starting with Cloud Cap's
Obtain Spirit Coal from the Wandering Line's caboose for master recipes
Achieve total monopoly over magical ingredient knowledge on Obojima
Discover what the Crawling Canopy is hiding — the Council of Kroo's territorial secrecy intrigues them

obstacle.description: Every rival coven guards their Almanac volume with their lives. Direct theft risks open coven war. The Council must acquire them without uniting the other covens against them. The Crawling Canopy keeps evading their scouting parties.

immediateObstacle.description: Sorolu — an elder spirit of earth and vines in the Gale Fields — is suffering from an unknown malady, weakening the land magic the coven draws on. If Sorolu dies or turns demon, the hedgerow wards may fail.

factions.want: The 5 remaining Almanac volumes. Spirit Coal from the Wandering Line. Access to the Crawling Canopy's secrets. Will trade cassette spell scrolls or favors but never their own volumes.
factions.tension: Every coven interaction colored by Almanac rivalry. Goro Goros' Mikiko is secretly a Fish Head apprentice. Council of Kroo keeps moving the Canopy to evade scouts. Tellu & Scale's heritage claim to Lilywin is a territorial threat. Dawn Blossom needs their ingredients.

relationships.reason: Pressuring for their Almanac volume
Almanac volume rivalry — demands a trade
Crawling Canopy territorial secrets
Lilywin ruins access — territorial threat
Economic dependency — ingredient supply
Mikiko is secretly a Fish Head apprentice

factions.name: Courier Brigade
factions.description: Postal knights order headquartered in a First Age bank in Yatamon. Maintains island-wide delivery network with fish-mouth postal boxes in every settlement. Led by Postmaster General Miranda Escalante.
factions.purpose: Maintain island-wide postal service, restore delivery to Corruption-cut eastern settlements, earn recognition as civil defense force

advantages.name: Outpost Network
advantages.description: Fort Harglo, Yatamon bank HQ, brigade halls and outposts in most towns. Maintains major roads across the Gale Fields

advantages.name: Postal Knights
advantages.description: Elite postal knights with rapid-response squad, trained bird mounts. Every knight has a home anywhere on the island

advantages.name: Flying Lantern & Vault
advantages.description: First Age bank vault for package storage, the Flying Lantern hot air balloon, Toggle minecarts and water flume

advantages.name: Waxworks Division
advantages.description: Dedicated arcane rogues for the most perilous deliveries — wax/fire enchantments

advantages.name: Postal Intelligence
advantages.description: Island-wide network — couriers see and hear everything. Fish-mouth postal boxes in every settlement

advantages.name: Deliverance Through Delivery
advantages.description: Unshakeable institutional creed. Sworn in through ceremonial oath

agenda.description: Map safe routes through eastern corrupted territory using Ranger intel
Acquire working First Age vehicles for faster dangerous-zone delivery
Establish a fortified relay station in the Brackwater Wetlands
Restore full delivery service to Polewater and eastern settlements
Earn formal recognition as Obojima's civil defense force

obstacle.description: The Rangers have the territory maps and safe-passage knowledge the Brigade needs, but sharing intel means publicly admitting the eastern front is collapsing. Brackwater paths washed away by the tsunami.

immediateObstacle.description: Imelda, a package thief in Yatamon, uses her spirit companion Choofi to raid unattended Brigade wagons. Gomber and Beeks are on her trail but she keeps evading them. Every stolen package undermines public trust.

factions.want: Rangers' Corruption territory maps and safe-passage routes. Working First Age vehicles. Toraf & Boulder's combat-experienced students as route escorts. A way to reopen communication with Polewater.
factions.tension: Loosely allied with Rangers but strained by pride. Fort Harglo sits in Fish Head territory. Roads they maintain in the Gale Fields may trace ancient Lilywin streets — Tellu & Scale's claim could complicate road maintenance.

relationships.reason: Eastern Corruption front, mutual need
Reinforcement requests
Fort Harglo in Fish Head territory — non-aggression arrangement

factions.name: Cloud Cap Coven
factions.description: Reclusive mountain witch coven hidden on Mount Arbora. Originated from a mountaintop village where 'hunting for lightning' was common practice. Guards sacred spirit sanctuaries and unknowingly protects the approaches to Oghmai's prison.
factions.purpose: Protect Mount Arbora's sacred spirit sanctuaries from encroachment, guard the Almanac volume, monitor the Corruption's spread to mountain waterways

advantages.name: Almanac Volume
advantages.description: 1 of 7 Almanac volumes (Mount Arbora region) — jealously guarded

advantages.name: Mountain Herbs
advantages.description: Rare high-altitude herbs and fungi found nowhere else; lightning-hunting tradition

advantages.name: Spirit Pathways
advantages.description: Deep knowledge of Mount Arbora's spirit pathways, sacred sites, and massive slope creatures

advantages.name: Hidden Mountain HQ
advantages.description: Hidden HQ in Obojima's most treacherous terrain — mists, crags, titanic creatures deter intruders

advantages.name: Nuharo/Grimcloak
advantages.description: Nuharo embedded in the Graysteps as 'Grimcloak,' gathering intelligence from mountain travelers

agenda.description: Protect Mount Arbora's sacred spirit sanctuaries from Lom & Salt's forge expansion
Resist Fish Head Coven's escalating pressure to surrender their Almanac volume
Monitor the Sky King's domain and the aeronaut craze from Sky Kite Valley
Assess whether the Corruption threatens Mount Arbora's rivers and meltwater
Maintain Nuharo's cover in the Graysteps and expand intelligence gathering

obstacle.description: Squeezed from all sides. Fish Head pressures for the Almanac volume. Lom & Salt's forge expansion cuts through spirit sanctuaries. AHA wants mountain sacred site access. Rock Raley's Sky King expedition threatens to bring outsiders. Every faction wants something from Mount Arbora.

immediateObstacle.description: In the Graysteps, village elder Phent keeps a Corruption-tainted spirit captive and plans to release it as a demon in Toggle. Nuharo operates next door and has no idea. If Phent's demon escapes, Nuharo's cover could unravel and outsiders would demand access to Cloud Cap's sacred sites.

factions.want: Fish Head to stop pressuring for the Almanac volume. Lom & Salt to respect spirit sanctuary boundaries. Outsiders to stay away from the Sky King's domain. Corruption intelligence for mountain waterways.
factions.tension: Fish Head's Almanac pressure is relentless. Lom & Salt trades sacred Guardian Sphere fragments to AHA — Cloud Cap considers this profane. The Deep Current seeks mountain access for unknown reasons. Rock Raley's Sky King expedition could bring chaos. Phent's demon scheme is a ticking bomb.

relationships.reason: Relentless pressure for the Almanac volume
Mount Arbora territorial — forge expansion into sacred ground
Deep Current seeks mountain access — Cloud Cap unknowingly guards Oghmai's prison

factions.name: Rangers of the Greenward Path
factions.description: Ranger organization operating from outposts and camps across eastern Obojima. On the front lines against the Corruption. Many already infected. The most militarily exposed faction — they're losing.
factions.purpose: Hold the eastern front against the Corruption, cure infected rangers, find the Corruption's origin
factions.region: Eastern Obojima (Brackwater Wetlands, Shade Wood, eastern coastline)

advantages.name: Corruption Maps
advantages.description: Detailed maps of Corruption spread, firsthand knowledge of corrupted territory survival

advantages.name: Vaulter's Axe
advantages.description: Signature ranger tool for Brackwater exploration. Field expertise in tracking and fighting Wetlands monsters

advantages.name: Military Alliances
advantages.description: Alliance with Toraf & Boulder. Attempting supply runs to Polewater. Crowsworn coven is their closest magical ally

advantages.name: Field Samples
advantages.description: Field samples of corrupted flora and fauna. Rangers embedded at AHA labs providing live Corruption data

advantages.name: Unwavering Conviction
advantages.description: Will not abandon the eastern front regardless of cost

agenda.description: Compare land Corruption samples with Mariners' Guild underwater samples
Identify common origin point or vulnerability in the Corruption
Develop a field-deployable countermeasure (working with Crowsworn potions)
Get relief supplies through to Polewater
Cure infected rangers before the disease becomes irreversible
Push the Corruption boundary back from populated areas

obstacle.description: The Rangers are losing. Many already infected — publicly admitting casualties could cause panic. Mariners' Guild has underwater samples they need but demands escorts in return. Spread impossibly thin: refugee camps, supply runs, AHA labs, and holding the Corruption boundary with dwindling healthy numbers.

immediateObstacle.description: Tetsuri, a corrupted Ranger hiding in Toggle under a false identity, is hooked on Venomous Rex's stonefish venom and waiting to kidnap Holly Clintock. If he succeeds, the Pointue stays broken and the Corruption's source stays hidden.

factions.want: Mariners' Guild underwater Corruption samples. Courier Brigade reinforcements and route escorts. Crowsworn's experimental potions. Healthy replacements.
factions.tension: Most urgent faction. Alliance with Toraf & Boulder is strong but both are exhausted. Crowsworn is their best magical ally but demands an Almanac volume trade. Tetsuri's betrayal will shake the Rangers' trust.

relationships.reason: Eastern Corruption front, mutual need
Master Boulder is a former Ranger — military alliance
Closest magical ally
Need underwater samples, competing priorities

factions.name: Lom & Salt's College of Arms
factions.description: Oldest sword school on Obojima, cut into the mountainside on Mount Arbora's upper reaches. Tradition of swordsmanship AND swordsmithing dating to the early Nakudama Age. Every sword school master on the island carries one of their blades.
factions.purpose: Forge a legendary blade by combining First Age alloys with traditional techniques, re-establish dominance over rival schools

advantages.name: Ancient Forge
advantages.description: Forge heated by Mount Arbora's geothermal vents; secret sanctum forge for worthy students

advantages.name: Metal Selection System
advantages.description: Swordsmanship AND swordsmithing tradition from the Second Age. Metal selection: cobalt, copper, lead, nickel, tungsten, zinc — each with unique properties

advantages.name: Legendary Reputation
advantages.description: Oldest martial institution. Every sword school master on the island carries one of their blades

advantages.name: Remote Mountain Position
advantages.description: Most remote school — the ascent itself serves as the first test

advantages.name: Four Virtues
advantages.description: Philosophical foundation: defense, aid, denial, restraint — 'A sword is a thing of terrible potential'

agenda.description: Obtain First Age metallurgy manuals from AHA (airplane maintenance docs detail alloy compositions)
Acquire Spirit Coal from the Wandering Line's caboose for the forge
Combine First Age alloys with traditional techniques and glyph-folding methods from Toggle
Forge a legendary blade worthy of the school's ancient reputation
Present the blade at a grand tournament, re-establishing dominance over rival schools

obstacle.description: The metallurgy manuals are split between AHA's archive and Broken Bird Airfield. AHA wants mountain sacred sites access in return — but Cloud Cap Coven controls that territory. Spirit Coal requires surviving the Coal Master's trial. Isolation that was once a strength now cuts them off from forming alliances.

immediateObstacle.description: Air pirates on the western slope include Lom's former bandit associates who know her past. If word spreads that a respected swordmaster was once a raider, it undermines the school's moral authority — the very foundation of their philosophy.

factions.want: First Age metallurgy manuals (AHA has them). Spirit Coal (Wandering Line). Collaboration with Toggle's forgemasters on glyph-folding. Cloud Cap Coven to acknowledge the school's ancient mountain claim.
factions.tension: Operating in Cloud Cap territory — forge expansion risks sacred ground. Canden & Moon's political ambitions threaten their prestige. Toraf & Boulder respects them but is consumed by the Corruption front. Tellu & Scale trained here and carry their blades.

relationships.reason: Mount Arbora territorial — forge expansion into sacred ground
Metallurgy knowledge trade
Respects skill, questions substance
Mutual respect between martial schools
Tellu & Scale trained here, carry their blades

factions.name: Canden & Moon's School
factions.description: The largest sword school on Obojima, occupying an ornate hexagonal structure in the heart of Yatamon. Emphasis on service — students bolster the city watch, escort AHA researchers, and handle monster threats.
factions.purpose: Train warriors who serve Obojima through community service, maintain the school's spotless reputation

advantages.name: Largest Student Body
advantages.description: Most popular school — most Obojimans have 'at least spent a summer' here. Students bolster city watch and escort AHA researchers

advantages.name: Yatamon Heart
advantages.description: Prime hexagonal structure in Yatamon's heart with training ground, dormitory, community service hub

advantages.name: Unblemished Reputation
advantages.description: Tremendous political influence through wisdom and producing fine warriors. Universally well-regarded

advantages.name: The Inscrutable Sword
advantages.description: Dance-like movements emphasizing swiftness — opponent never sure if attacking or defending

advantages.name: Four Acts of Service
advantages.description: Guard duty, judging contests, monster threats, and escorting AHA researchers into subway tunnels

agenda.description: Address the Goro Goros problem — magical graffiti defaces the school publicly
Demonstrate the school's value through expanded community service
Win a decisive public tournament victory over a rival school
Ensure the school's integrity remains unblemished as security deteriorates
Fulfill Master Canden's vision: every student should serve Obojima, not just themselves

obstacle.description: The Goro Goros' magical graffiti mocks them and resists removal. A violent crackdown would destroy their image of restraint. Meanwhile Toraf & Boulder is fighting and dying in the east — Canden & Moon's students have numbers but lack combat experience. Sending them to the front could be a massacre.

immediateObstacle.description: Students escorting AHA researchers into subway tunnels are encountering increasingly dangerous conditions. A student going missing or killed would force the masters to cut off AHA's escort arrangement, crippling Frond's dig.

factions.want: Goro Goros to stop defacing the school. A rival school willing to accept a formal tournament challenge. Recognition of community service record. Safe subway passage for students.
factions.tension: Goro Goros' Mikiko is secretly a budding witch making pigment potions. Toraf & Boulder views the school as privileged and untested. Lom & Salt considers their emphasis on form over substance misguided. The subway escort missions make them AHA's most important local ally.

relationships.reason: Street vs establishment — magical graffiti vandalism campaign
Toraf & Boulder views them as privileged and untested
Mutual respect, philosophical disagreement
Subway escort arrangement — informal but critical

factions.name: Toraf & Boulder's School of Guts & Grit
factions.description: Practical combat sword school on the southernmost point of the Pale Hills overlooking the Brackwater Wetlands. Field training IS the curriculum — even the greenest students go on expeditions. The most militarily exposed school.
factions.purpose: Hold the Brackwater against the Corruption, train real fighters through field combat, protect refugees

advantages.name: Battle-Hardened Students
advantages.description: Real combat experience against Wetlands monsters and Corruption. Field training IS the curriculum

advantages.name: Ranger Alliance
advantages.description: Military alliance with Rangers — Master Boulder is a former Ranger and still holds his oath

advantages.name: The Striking Snake
advantages.description: Three strikes from the same guard position, obscuring the target — developed to counter Brackwater monsters

advantages.name: Unwavering Conviction
advantages.description: Will not retreat from the eastern front. Previous masters died and summoned Toraf and Boulder as successors

advantages.name: Pale Hills Tower
advantages.description: Stone tower on the Pale Hills — natural watchtower and defensible position overlooking the Wetlands

agenda.description: Hold the Brackwater against the Corruption's westward spread
Send student expeditions to Polewater to help rebuild
Train enough students to rotate front-line shifts without burning out
Secure uncorrupted fresh water — the Wetlands are being poisoned
Get reinforcements from anywhere willing to fight

obstacle.description: Asking for help means admitting the east is losing. Canden & Moon has numbers but their students lack combat experience. Rangers are their closest allies but both are exhausted. The previous masters died of a Wetlands sickness. The masters are NOT friends — bound only by mutual contempt for other schools.

immediateObstacle.description: Vespoma have overrun Hakumon's Ramen Shop. A student expedition to Polewater hasn't reported back. Boulder wants to go after the missing students but leaving the school undefended means trusting Toraf alone. Neither master trusts the other that far.

factions.want: Courier Brigade soldiers. Canden & Moon students (trained up fast). Clean water. Crowsworn's Corruption-resistance potions. Missing student expedition returned safely.
factions.tension: Most militarily exposed faction. Respects Rangers but both are running on fumes. Contempt for Canden & Moon's privileged students. The masters' volatile relationship held together by necessity. Hakumon's crisis and missing Polewater expedition force them to divide already-thin resources.

relationships.reason: Master Boulder is a former Ranger — military alliance
Reinforcement requests
Contempt for privileged, untested students
Need their Corruption-resistance potions

factions.name: Dawn Blossom Guild
factions.description: The secretive currency minting guild that controls Obojima's entire economy. Leadership identities hidden. Sole authority to mint Gold Flowers, Sea Petals, and Copper Buds. Maintains strict neutrality.
factions.purpose: Maintain currency stability and the island's monetary system

advantages.name: Currency Monopoly
advantages.description: Sole authority to mint Gold Flowers, Sea Petals, and Copper Buds

advantages.name: Coin-Pressing Machinery
advantages.description: First Age coin-pressing machinery enchanted with spirit magic

advantages.name: Spirit Essence Vault
advantages.description: Vault of pure spirit essence used in minting enchantments

advantages.name: Anonymous Leadership
advantages.description: Leadership identities hidden — can't be pressured politically

advantages.name: Economic Control
advantages.description: Control the entire island's economy through currency supply

agenda.description: Secure a reliable supply of crimson octopus ink from Lionfish King's octopus
Acquire rare ingredients from Fish Head Coven for new coin enchantment batches
Collect working First Age vending machines to expand coin distribution
Maintain currency stability despite Corruption disrupting eastern trade
Prevent any faction from gaining enough power to threaten the monetary system

obstacle.description: Dependent on two hostile factions for critical resources: the Lionfish King controls the only crimson octopus (ink source), and the Fish Head Coven controls magical ingredients for enchantments. Both leverage this dependency for favorable exchange rates.

factions.want: Reliable octopus ink supply (Lionfish King). Coven ingredients (Fish Head). First Age vending machines. Will pay well and stay neutral — unless the money is threatened.
factions.tension: The invisible hand. Every faction needs their currency. Strict neutrality but could tip any conflict by withholding or flooding coin supply. Someone is counterfeiting.

relationships.reason: Economic dependency — octopus ink
Economic dependency — magical ingredients

factions.name: Flying Phin's Airship Service
factions.description: One-man operation at the derelict Broken Bird Airfield. Phin, a former AHA member, has devoted his life to restoring a First Age aircraft called 'the Menace.' Harpies occupy the control tower. Unknown to Phin, a spirit named Plitsu is sabotaging his work.
factions.purpose: Restore the Menace to powered flight, figure out who keeps stealing tools, achieve real aviation

advantages.name: Broken Bird Airfield
advantages.description: Multiple First Age aircraft frames, 'the Menace' restoration, runway, two hangars of salvageable parts

advantages.name: Airplane Plans
advantages.description: Airplane plans stored in the harpy-occupied control tower. Phin's AHA background gives deep First Age mechanics knowledge

advantages.name: Flying Machine Mechanic
advantages.description: One of the best flying machine mechanics on Obojima — even if results are limited

advantages.name: Dangerous Airfield
advantages.description: A rite of passage for Young Stewards, a destination for flight enthusiasts

agenda.description: Get the Menace airworthy — restore it to sustained powered flight
Figure out why tools keep disappearing (blames harpies — it's actually Plitsu)
Retrieve the airplane plans from inside the harpy-occupied control tower
Find spirits willing to power a biplane engine
Achieve real flight — reach the Sky King's domain or the Vanishing Mountain

obstacle.description: Everything conspires against flight. Plitsu secretly sabotages his work. Airplane plans locked in harpy territory. Powered flight requires multiple spirits in concert. A dormant slime colony beneath the runway would emerge if anything heavy trundles down the strip. And Rumble Hill (actually a Cat of Prodigious Size) would fixate on a flying machine.

immediateObstacle.description: Young Stewards snuck onto the airfield as a dare and haven't come back — believed in the harpies' clutches. Meanwhile, Bomber the harpy is approaching visitors offering information in exchange for help flying again.

factions.want: His tools back (from Plitsu). The airplane plans from the control tower. Spirits willing to power the Menace. To be left alone to work.
factions.tension: Former AHA membership is a live connection — AHA wants airfield tech. Rock Raley's aviation craze is the competition. The harpies are an uneasy coexistence. Plitsu's sabotage is invisible to everyone.

relationships.reason: Former member — AHA wants airfield tech, Phin keeps it to himself

factions.name: Goro Goros
factions.description: Youth street gang in Yatamon led by Tatsu. Known for elaborate magical graffiti that moves, whispers, and resists removal. Their power depends entirely on Mikiko, a secret Fish Head Coven apprentice who creates the magic ink.
factions.purpose: Prove street magic is legitimate, humiliate Canden & Moon, be taken seriously as a real faction

advantages.name: Magical Graffiti Ink
advantages.description: Mikiko's creation — tags that move, whisper, and resist removal

advantages.name: Subway Knowledge
advantages.description: Intimate knowledge of Yatamon's underground First Age subway tunnels

advantages.name: Magic Spray Paint
advantages.description: Stash of First Age spray paint cans that amplify magical ink effects

advantages.name: Street Eyes
advantages.description: Street-level eyes and ears across Yatamon's markets and alleys

advantages.name: Folk Heroes
advantages.description: Popular among Yatamon's working class

agenda.description: Tag every Canden & Moon building with moving graffiti
Acquire a cassette tape ward spell from Fish Head Coven to protect their tunnels
Discover what's at the end of the sealed subway tunnels beneath Yatamon
Prove street magic is as legitimate as coven witchery
Be taken seriously as a real faction, not dismissed as delinquents

obstacle.description: Mikiko's double life. If Fish Head Coven discovers she's teaching magic to unlicensed street kids, they'll demand her return and punish the gang. The gang's power depends entirely on her ink — without Mikiko, they're just kids with spray paint.

factions.want: A cassette tape ward spell (Fish Head has them). Canden & Moon publicly embarrassed. Recognition from any adult faction that they matter.
factions.tension: Mikiko's secret is a ticking bomb. Canden & Moon's Student Captain Reiko is hunting them. The sealed subway tunnels could connect to the Wandering Line — or something worse. Fish Head's spy may already suspect Mikiko.

relationships.reason: Street vs establishment — vandalism campaign
Mikiko is secretly a Fish Head apprentice

factions.name: Council of Kroo
factions.description: Four eccentric hermits living in tree houses in the Crawling Canopy — a mobile forest they can guide. Running 'cosmic calculations' on a First Age computer. May be sitting on the island's most significant discovery or its destruction.
factions.purpose: Complete cosmic calculations, determine what's buried beneath the Canopy, keep Fish Head Coven out

advantages.name: First Age Computer
advantages.description: Working First Age chunky computer used for 'cosmic calculations'

advantages.name: Floppy Disk Keys
advantages.description: Floppy disks that may be vault keys to something buried underground

advantages.name: Canopy Control
advantages.description: Control of the Crawling Canopy's movement — they guide the mobile forest

advantages.name: Wicked Wizard Tavern
advantages.description: Hidden meeting place inside the Canopy

advantages.name: Harmless Eccentrics
advantages.description: Everyone dismisses them as harmless eccentrics

agenda.description: Keep the Fish Head Coven's scouts out of the Crawling Canopy
Complete the 'cosmic calculations' on the First Age computer
Determine if the thing buried beneath the Canopy is a superweapon or just a very large machine
If it's dangerous, ensure it stays buried forever
If it's useful, figure out how to activate it without destroying the island

obstacle.description: Fish Head Coven suspects the Canopy hides something valuable and sends regular scouting parties. The Council can move the forest to evade them, but each move disrupts the calculations and delays answers about what's buried below.

factions.want: Fish Head Coven to leave them alone. More floppy disks (scattered across island). Someone who can actually program the computer.
factions.tension: Fish Head's interest is intensifying. If the buried thing is real, it could be the most significant discovery since the First Age. The Council is genuinely unsure if they're protecting the island or sitting on its destruction.

relationships.reason: Crawling Canopy territorial secrets
Floppy disk calculations may relate to Oghmai's seal

factions.name: Tellu & Scale's School of Blades
factions.description: Nomadic sword school that migrates along the western coast, never stopping. Led by the ancient nakudama Master Tellu. Carries oral histories of pre-First Age Obojima that no written record preserves. Seeks to settle at the lost nakudama capital of Lilywin.
factions.purpose: Reach the Lilywin ruins, discover the school's founding story, settle if claim holds

advantages.name: First Age Stopwatch
advantages.description: Master Tellu's heirloom stopwatch with mysterious undecoded functions

advantages.name: Oral History
advantages.description: Oral history of pre-First Age Obojima that no written record preserves

advantages.name: The Tempered Mind
advantages.description: Unmatched philosophical sword training

advantages.name: Nomadic Philosophy
advantages.description: Nomadic philosophy that attracts devoted students

agenda.description: Negotiate safe passage through Fish Head Coven territory in the Gale Fields
Reach the Lilywin ruins — Tellu believes the lost nakudama capital holds the school's founding story
Decode the stopwatch's hidden functions (may require AHA or Council of Kroo's computer)
Discover whether the school has a legitimate claim to Lilywin
Settle at Lilywin if the claim holds — becoming the first sword school with ancient roots

obstacle.description: Fish Head Coven controls the Gale Fields and won't grant passage without something in return. Tellu's nakudama heritage may give the school a legitimate claim to Lilywin that threatens Coven territorial dominance. The Coven would rather the ruins stay forgotten.

factions.want: Passage through Gale Fields (Fish Head controls). Lilywin ruins access. Someone to decode the stopwatch (AHA or Council of Kroo). Their oral histories could be priceless to AHA.
factions.tension: Fish Head sees them as a territorial threat. AHA would trade anything for their oral histories. The stopwatch may be connected to whatever the Council of Kroo is computing. Canden & Moon sees a nomadic school settling down as validating a rival.

relationships.reason: Lilywin ruins access — territorial threat
Could trade oral histories for stopwatch decoding
Trained here — both masters carry Lom & Salt blades
Settling at Lilywin would validate a rival

factions.name: The Crowsworn
factions.description: Witch coven in the Brackwater Wetlands, on the front lines of the Corruption. Led by Crow Mother Vex. Brewing experimental Corruption-resistance potions with a ~40% success rate. If they fall, the east's magical defense collapses.
factions.purpose: Brew a reliable Corruption-resistance potion, deploy a mass countermeasure before the Corruption crosses the wetlands boundary

advantages.name: Almanac Volume
advantages.description: 1 of 7 Almanac volumes (Brackwater Wetlands region)

advantages.name: Corruption Potions
advantages.description: Experimental Corruption-resistance potions (partially working, ~40% success rate)

advantages.name: Crow Intelligence
advantages.description: Network of crow familiars providing intelligence across eastern Obojima

advantages.name: Propane Cauldrons
advantages.description: First Age propane burners repurposed for rapid cauldron work

advantages.name: Ranger Alliance
advantages.description: Closest magical ally to Rangers of the Greenward Path

agenda.description: Obtain Mariners' Guild underwater Corruption samples (different strain than land)
Compare land and sea Corruption to identify a common vulnerability
Brew a reliable Corruption-resistance potion
Acquire Fish Head's Shallows Almanac volume for underwater ingredient knowledge
Deploy a mass countermeasure before the Corruption crosses the wetlands boundary

obstacle.description: Fish Head Coven has the Shallows Almanac volume describing underwater ingredients critical to the cure. They'll only trade for the Crowsworn's own Brackwater volume — giving it up means losing their regional foraging advantage at the worst possible time.

factions.want: Mariners' Guild underwater Corruption samples. Fish Head's Shallows Almanac volume. Rangers' field data. Clean ingredients from uncorrupted land.
factions.tension: If they fall, the east's magical defense collapses. Brewer Thistle may already be partially corrupted. Fish Head's demand for a volume trade feels like extortion while the world burns. The Rangers trust them completely.

relationships.reason: Closest magical ally
Corruption cure research — need underwater samples
Almanac volume rivalry — extortionate trade demands

factions.name: The Deep Current
factions.description: Shadow faction with cells embedded across other factions. No one knows the society exists. Seeks to locate and breach the Prison of Oghmai inside Mount Arbora, believing the demon emperor's power is key to nakudama restoration.
factions.purpose: Locate the Prison of Oghmai, break the seal, harness or free the demon emperor to restore nakudama greatness

advantages.name: Embedded Agents
advantages.description: Members hidden inside AHA and possibly other factions — no one knows the society exists

advantages.name: Oghmai Texts
advantages.description: Ancient nakudama texts describing Oghmai's imprisonment, the seal's construction, and the prison's general location

advantages.name: Krocius's Access
