advantages.description: Krocius has direct access to AHA's dig and subway tunnel mapping

advantages.name: True Belief
advantages.description: Conviction that Oghmai's power is the key to nakudama restoration — willing to risk everything

agenda.description: Use Krocius's position in AHA to map the subway tunnels beneath Yatamon
Locate the Wandering Line depot at the Prison of Oghmai inside Mount Arbora
Recover or reconstruct the seal-breaking ritual from scattered nakudama texts
Gain access to the Prison and harness Oghmai's power — or free him outright
Restore nakudama to their former greatness using the demon emperor's might

obstacle.description: The Prison is inside Mount Arbora but Cloud Cap Coven guards the sacred sites. The Wandering Line is unpredictable. Subway tunnels mostly collapsed. The seal was created by Shalwin's most powerful mages — breaking it may require knowledge or artifacts that no longer exist.

factions.want: AHA's subway tunnel maps (Krocius is working on it). Wandering Line access. Cloud Cap's mountain spirit pathway maps. Council of Kroo's floppy disks. Ermina Flopfoot's Oghmai research.
factions.tension: If AHA discovers Krocius's true purpose, the operation collapses. Cloud Cap would declare war on anyone digging into the mountain. Council of Kroo may be sitting on something related. Lom & Salt's forge expansion could accidentally breach something. The biggest question: is the Corruption connected to Oghmai's imprisonment?

relationships.reason: Krocius secretly steering digs toward Oghmai's prison
Mountain access conflict — Cloud Cap unknowingly guards the prison
Floppy disk calculations may relate to the seal

hooks.rumor: The Mariners' Guild is desperate to recover a stolen navigation device from the Lionfish King's warship.
hooks.truth: The Aquatic Stabilizer — a First Age magic gyroscope — is mounted on the Doomspine. Without it, the Pointue submarine can't navigate deep currents.
hooks.reward: Free passage on the Pointue, Mariners' Guild membership
hooks.danger: Underwater fortress, elite crab sentinels, the Lionfish King himself

hooks.rumor: Paloma Clintock has been launching increasingly reckless solo raids. Something's wrong with her.
hooks.truth: She's been secretly infected with Corruption from a fish folk dart and won't tell anyone.
hooks.danger: Paloma is deteriorating fast and won't accept help willingly

hooks.rumor: The Lionfish King's wizard is offering a fortune to anyone who can translate ancient nakudama texts.
hooks.truth: The Royal Lineages track the nakudama royal bloodline. The King wants to find and marry a living heir.
hooks.reward: Lionfish King's favor, priceless crimson octopus ink
hooks.danger: Legitimizing a tyrant, AHA ethical concerns

hooks.rumor: A giant octopus near the sunken town seems to be in distress, guarding something against its will.
hooks.truth: Bloodfin holds Lucinda's eggs hostage in a giant clam. Freeing the eggs frees Lucinda.
hooks.reward: Lucinda's gratitude, info about Bloodfin's operations
hooks.danger: Bloodfin's gang, Slurpgill lurking nearby

hooks.rumor: Strange sounds echo from the sealed lower levels of AHA headquarters. Researchers report equipment going missing.
hooks.truth: Corrupted viperfish folk loyal to Venomous Rex have infiltrated the flooded basement and are looking for a way up.
hooks.danger: Corrupted fish folk, volatile Corruption specimens in labs above

hooks.rumor: Dr. Frond's excavation beneath Yatamon has broken into tunnels that go deeper than anyone expected.
hooks.truth: Krocius is secretly steering the dig toward passages leading to the Prison of Oghmai inside Mount Arbora.
hooks.danger: Collapsed tunnels, hostile spirits, Krocius's hidden agenda

hooks.rumor: An ancient spirit in the Gale Fields is sick. The land itself seems to be weakening.
hooks.truth: Elder spirit Sorolu is suffering from early Corruption. If it dies, the Fish Head domain's hedgerow wards fail.
hooks.reward: Fish Head Coven favor, rare magical ingredients
hooks.danger: Corruption exposure, Sorolu turning demon

hooks.rumor: Courier Brigade packages keep vanishing from wagons in Yatamon. The detective duo Gomber and Beeks are on the case.
hooks.truth: Imelda uses her spirit Choofi to sniff out valuables and raid unattended wagons.
hooks.reward: Courier Brigade favor, free delivery service
hooks.danger: Choofi's tracking ability makes Imelda hard to ambush

hooks.rumor: A young boy at the Brigade HQ looks panicked. He keeps glancing at the door like he expects someone.
hooks.truth: 13-year-old Lomi delivered a letter to the wrong address and needs to fix it before his sister Ashi finds out.
hooks.reward: Small coin reward, Lomi's eternal gratitude
hooks.danger: Low — but the misdelivered letter may contain sensitive info

hooks.rumor: Villagers in the Graysteps report strange sounds from elder Phent's cellar. He insists it's just his cat.
hooks.truth: Phent keeps a Corruption-tainted spirit captive and is deliberately driving it to madness to release as a demon in Toggle.
hooks.danger: Demon could escape prematurely, Nuharo's cover blown

hooks.rumor: A new face in Toggle — quiet, keeps to himself, asks a lot of questions about the Mariners' Guild.
hooks.truth: Corrupted Ranger Tetsuri is waiting to kidnap Holly Clintock for Venomous Rex. Hooked on stonefish venom.
hooks.danger: Tetsuri is a skilled Ranger and desperate — will fight to the death

hooks.rumor: Refugees in the Shade Wood are being picked off at night by something in the trees.
hooks.truth: Skeletonized howlers hunt the refugee camp. A corrupted ranger and a druid hold the line alone.
hooks.danger: Corruption exposure, skeletonized howlers, camp may be overrun

hooks.rumor: A traveler collapsed at the sword school steps, gasping 'Hakumon's...' before passing out.
hooks.truth: Vespoma with enchanting speech have overrun Hakumon's Ramen Shop, tormenting trapped patrons.
hooks.reward: Free ramen for life, Toraf & Boulder respect
hooks.danger: Vespoma enchanting speech can charm adventurers

hooks.rumor: A Toraf & Boulder student expedition sent to Polewater hasn't reported back.
hooks.truth: The students are pinned down by Corruption-warped creatures on the Wetlands path to Polewater.
hooks.reward: Toraf & Boulder alliance, Boulder's personal gratitude
hooks.danger: Corruption-warped creatures, treacherous Wetlands terrain

hooks.rumor: Some Young Stewards snuck onto the Broken Bird Airfield on a dare and haven't come back.
hooks.truth: The kids are being held by the harpies in the control tower. Bomber the flightless harpy might help.
hooks.danger: 12 harpy gang, control tower is their territory

hooks.rumor: Phin swears the harpies are stealing his tools again. He's ready to start a war over it.
hooks.truth: Adorable spirit Plitsu is the real thief. Believes First Age flight tech should stay grounded.
hooks.reward: Phin's tools recovered, harpy tensions defused
hooks.danger: Low — but Plitsu is cute enough to make you question if Phin deserves his tools back

hooks.rumor: Magical graffiti keeps appearing on Canden & Moon's school walls. The paint moves and whispers.
hooks.truth: The Goro Goros use magic ink created by Mikiko, a secret Fish Head Coven apprentice.
hooks.danger: Exposing Mikiko could trigger Fish Head Coven retaliation

hooks.rumor: Air pirates on Mount Arbora's western slope seem to know Master Lom. They keep calling her 'old friend.'
hooks.truth: Lom was once a bandit who raided these same foothills. Some pirates are former associates.
hooks.danger: Exposing Lom's past could undermine the school's moral authority

hooks.rumor: An eccentric man in seven stacked hats says he'll pay handsomely for 'the keys' — old flat square things from the First Age.
hooks.truth: Edgarton needs more floppy disks for the First Age computer running 'cosmic calculations' about what's buried under the Crawling Canopy.
hooks.reward: Council of Kroo favor, access to the Wicked Wizard Tavern
hooks.danger: Floppy disks are scattered in First Age ruins across the island

hooks.rumor: A gaunt woman surrounded by crows needs underwater Corruption samples. She'll trade powerful potions.
hooks.truth: Crow Mother Vex needs to compare land and sea Corruption strains. Current cure success rate is only 40%.
hooks.danger: Gathering underwater Corruption samples is extremely dangerous

hooks.rumor: Master Tellu carries a First Age device she says 'counts something other than time.' She seeks someone to decode it.
hooks.truth: The stopwatch has hidden functions. May require AHA's expertise or the Council of Kroo's computer to unlock.
hooks.danger: Low — but the stopwatch's true purpose may be world-changing

hooks.rumor: Merchants complain that some Gold Flowers feel 'wrong.' A masked figure has been asking questions at markets.
hooks.truth: Someone is counterfeiting the island's currency. Dawn Blossom's Assessor is hunting the counterfeiter.
hooks.reward: Dawn Blossom's favor — they pay very well
hooks.danger: The counterfeiter may have powerful backers

hooks.rumor: The short elf woman at Murgin's Tavern knows something about the Corruption. Buy her a drink.
hooks.truth: Stout Crumm was among the first Rangers to encounter the Corruption. What she saw broke her. She communicates only via chalk on slate.
hooks.reward: Critical intel about the early Corruption encounters
hooks.danger: Low — but what she reveals may be deeply unsettling

hooks.rumor: Polewater was devastated by the tsunami. They need supplies desperately but the roads are gone.
hooks.truth: The settlement is cut off. Corruption-warped creatures and destroyed infrastructure block all routes.
hooks.reward: Polewater gratitude, Courier Brigade favor, Ranger alliance
hooks.danger: Treacherous journey through corrupted Brackwater Wetlands

hooks.rumor: The old telescope operator at AHA keeps hearing voices on a First Age radio. He says they're 'war dispatches.'
hooks.truth: The radio emits garbled snippets in an unknown language. Who or what is broadcasting?
hooks.reward: Major discovery about the First Age
hooks.danger: Unknown — the source of the broadcasts is a complete mystery

clocks.name: Repair the Pointue
clocks.description: The Mariners' Guild works to repair their submarine. Requires Holly + southern lodge access + AHA schematics + Aquatic Stabilizer recovery.

consequences.description: Pointue launches deep-water expedition to find Corruption source

clocks.name: The Lionfish King's Coronation
clocks.description: The Lionfish King seeks to decipher the Royal Lineages, find a nakudama royal heir, and arrange a marriage to legitimize his rule.

consequences.description: Lionfish King gains legitimate royal status — fish folk unite under him

clocks.name: Viperfish Breach AHA HQ
clocks.description: Corrupted viperfish folk in AHA's flooded basement levels are searching for a way into the upper floors. AHA doesn't know they're there.

consequences.description: Viperfish breach AHA labs — Corruption specimens and infected rangers exposed

clocks.name: Almanac Monopoly
clocks.description: Fish Head Coven works to acquire remaining 5 Almanac volumes from rival covens through trade, trickery, or intimidation.

consequences.description: Fish Head Coven achieves total magical ingredient monopoly on Obojima

clocks.name: Sorolu's Decline
clocks.description: Elder spirit Sorolu is suffering from an unknown malady. If it dies or turns demon, Fish Head domain loses its spiritual anchor and hedgerow wards may fail.

consequences.description: Sorolu turns demon — Fish Head hedgerow wards collapse, domain exposed

clocks.name: Restore Eastern Delivery
clocks.description: Courier Brigade maps safe routes through corrupted territory to restore service to Polewater and eastern settlements.

consequences.description: Full postal service restored to eastern Obojima

clocks.name: Phent's Demon Scheme
clocks.description: Village elder Phent in the Graysteps keeps a Corruption-tainted spirit captive, prodding it toward madness. Plans to release the resulting demon in Toggle.

consequences.description: Demon released in Toggle — panic, spirit backlash, Nuharo's cover at risk

clocks.name: Corruption Advances West
clocks.description: The Corruption boundary creeps westward through the Brackwater Wetlands toward populated areas. Rangers fight to hold the line.

consequences.description: Corruption crosses wetlands boundary into Gale Fields — island-wide crisis

clocks.name: Tetsuri's Betrayal
clocks.description: Corrupted Ranger Tetsuri hides in Toggle under a false identity, waiting for Holly Clintock to arrive so he can kidnap her for Venomous Rex.

consequences.description: Holly kidnapped — Pointue repair impossible, Corruption research stalls

clocks.name: Forge the Legendary Blade
clocks.description: Lom & Salt work to combine First Age alloys with traditional techniques to forge a legendary blade for a grand tournament.

consequences.description: Legendary blade presented at tournament — Lom & Salt re-established as supreme

clocks.name: Subway Tunnel Collapse
clocks.description: Students escorting AHA researchers into Yatamon's subway tunnels face increasingly dangerous conditions as the dig pushes deeper.

consequences.description: Student killed in tunnels — Canden & Moon cuts off AHA escort, dig crippled

clocks.name: Missing Polewater Expedition
clocks.description: A student expedition sent to help rebuild Polewater hasn't reported back. The Corruption-warped creatures in the Wetlands grow more dangerous.

consequences.description: Expedition confirmed lost — Toraf & Boulder morale shattered, Boulder leaves to search alone

clocks.name: Counterfeiting Crisis
clocks.description: Someone is counterfeiting Gold Flowers. Dawn Blossom seeks to find and stop the counterfeiter before currency confidence collapses.

consequences.description: Counterfeit coins flood market — economic panic, trade routes disrupted

clocks.name: The Menace Takes Flight
clocks.description: Phin works to restore the Menace aircraft — but Plitsu sabotages every attempt, the harpies guard the plans, and slime lurks beneath the runway.

consequences.description: The Menace achieves sustained flight — awakens Rumble Hill (giant cat)

clocks.name: Mikiko's Secret
clocks.description: Mikiko secretly uses Fish Head Coven potion knowledge to make magic ink for the Goro Goros. Discovery by the Coven would be catastrophic.

consequences.description: Fish Head Coven demands Mikiko's return — Goro Goros lose magic ink, gang powerless

clocks.name: The Cosmic Calculations
clocks.description: Council of Kroo runs computations on their First Age computer to determine what's buried beneath the Crawling Canopy.

consequences.description: Truth revealed — superweapon or ancient machine beneath the Canopy

clocks.name: Pilgrimage to Lilywin
clocks.description: Tellu & Scale negotiate passage through Fish Head territory to reach the lost nakudama capital of Lilywin.

consequences.description: Tellu & Scale settles at Lilywin — first sword school with ancient roots

clocks.name: Corruption Cure Research
clocks.description: Crowsworn brew experimental Corruption-resistance potions. Current success rate ~40%. Need underwater samples and Fish Head's Shallows Almanac.

consequences.description: Reliable Corruption-resistance potion — eastern front stabilized

clocks.name: Unsealing Oghmai's Prison
clocks.description: The Deep Current works through Krocius inside AHA to map subway tunnels toward Mount Arbora and the Prison of Oghmai.

consequences.description: Oghmai freed or his power harnessed — island-shaking catastrophe or salvation

clocks.name: Slurpgill's Hag Coven
clocks.description: Sea hag Slurpgill grooms Bloodfin to become a hag and start a coven. If successful, a new underwater threat emerges allied with Venomous Rex.

consequences.description: Bloodfin transforms into a hag — new coven allied with Venomous Rex threatens northern waters

clocks.name: Paloma's Secret Infection
clocks.description: Paloma Clintock was infected with Corruption from a fish folk dart. She hasn't told anyone and continues launching reckless solo raids.

consequences.description: Paloma succumbs to Corruption — devastating blow to Mariners' Guild and Captain Clintock

companionSpirits.name: Disaster
companionSpirits.description: Marcel's pelican companion. Helps him navigate despite his blindness.

companionSpirits.name: Mr. Tamlin
companionSpirits.description: Ancient crab spirit that carries the elderly navigator Leobini on its back.

companionSpirits.name: Abi
companionSpirits.description: Protective invisible spirit companion to the apprentice Tan. Very protective of the boy.

companionSpirits.name: The Lady
companionSpirits.description: Highly sociable cat spirit that wanders the Witching Tower grounds, following interesting visitors.

companionSpirits.name: The Mighty Peapaleap
companionSpirits.description: Fat fluffy long-haired cat who rides a floating square cushion. Wanders the Witching Tower with The Lady.

companionSpirits.name: Beeks
companionSpirits.description: Paunchy bird spirit and detective partner to Gomber. Pretty much just says 'Beek!' but Gomber understands him completely.

companionSpirits.name: Choofi
companionSpirits.description: Floating fur-covered spirit that can identify any object by smell alone. Used by Imelda to raid Brigade wagons.

companionSpirits.name: Sorrow
companionSpirits.description: Silent octopus spirit companion to Warlock Mr. Basingstoke at the Witchery academy in Yatamon.

companionSpirits.name: Borisss
companionSpirits.description: Sea snake spirit fiercely loyal to Bloodfin. Coiled around a teddy bear he found when the gang first arrived.

companionSpirits.name: Morris
companionSpirits.description: Cowardly giant seahorse spirit intimidated into serving Bloodfin. Terrified of Slurpgill. Will lie to or tattle on outsiders.

companionSpirits.name: Plitsu
companionSpirits.description: Adorable little spectral spirit at Broken Bird Airfield. Believes First Age flight tech should stay grounded. Secretly stealing Phin's tools.

companionSpirits.name: Vutochi
companionSpirits.description: Foremost Corruption researcher at AHA. Exists in both Physical and Spirit Realms simultaneously. Transforms into a tall imposing mage in the Spirit Realm.
